The game provides three setups: Equal, Random, and Historical. Card play generates changes in the AOP levels of the players.

name: Battle of the Atlantic
description:
“War at Sea 1939 – 1943. German High Seas Fleet vs the British Royal Navy. Victory: Be the first to win 3 hands. There are 3 card types: Tactics, Tonnage, and Technology. Each card has an individual point value.”

The winner of a hand is determined by the point values of the cards played by each player. The game lasts five turns, corresponding to the years 1939 to 1943.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, World War II

name: Blown Away
description:
“18th Century Naval Combat. Abstract skirmish level Ship combat. Each figure represents a single Ship (unit). Victory: You win if you Sink the opposing Flagship.”

The game is played on an 8x8 grid or chessboard. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the ships. Each player starts with an identical assortment of ships: one Flagship, two Ships of the Line, two Frigates, and three Sloops. The game uses a custom deck of cards which is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from the common deck, and card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.

name: Blue vs Gray Combined Arms
description: A Civil War themed diceless strategy game played on an 8x8 grid or chess board. Each player builds a custom army of sixteen units composed of a General and an assortment of five other regiment sized units: Cavalry, Infantry, Riflemen, Artillery, and Mortar. Optional rules are provided for terrain (hills and forts), elite units, experienced units, and reinforcements. The object of the game is to occupy all of the Forts or destroy the enemy General.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Caravan
description:
“Players control Arabian caravans going back and forth across the deserts, acting as Middlemen between Europe and the Orient.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any similar 8x8 grid. Row 1 on the board represents Europe, row 8 is the Orient, and rows 2 through 7 are designated Middle Eastern rows. Each Middle Eastern row receives one Oasis and one Quicksand marker on different random spaces. Four pawns are used – one for each player to represent their caravans, one to represent Bandits, and one to represent a Sandstorm. An eight-sided die is required for play.

A Players chooses to start in Europe or the Orient. Players draw cards to obtain goods or soldiers, and to collect movement cards. Players then play movement cards to transport their goods to the opposite end of the board where they may be sold for Gold. The first player to accumulate fifty Gold is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Cave Wars
description: The game is played on a chessboard or 8x8 grid representing a subterranean setting. The map is randomly generated each game by filling the board with sixty-four terrain tiles. Each player starts in control of one Lair. The object of the game is to occupy all eight Lairs on the board. The players earn Gold to build an army of cave creatures, such as Dwarves, Orcs, Cave Trolls, Kobolds, Troglodytes, and Gnomes. The players keep a hand of Event Cards which can be played to affect movement and combat.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: City States
description:
“War and politics in ancient Greece. Six and Ten sided dice are required. The Board: Use a map of the Aegean circa 430 B.C. Divide the map into spaces, either hexagonal or irregular shaped. Make sure to include cities that existed at the time. Victory: Control the most city states at the end of 36 turns.”

Each player starts with a home city, three leaders, ten gold, and six city traits. A city also receives two armies, two rowers, and two fleets, unless the city is landlocked in which case it just receives four armies. Each player also starts with five cards. The cards can be used as an aid in areas such as battle, diplomacy, and movement.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Combat Dice
description:
“Get ready to throw lots of dice around. The game simulates two opposing fantasy warriors locked in deadly combat.”

Combat results are generated by rolling several six-sided dice every turn. Each number corresponds to one of six different attributes: 1=Attack, 2=Dodge, 3=Damage, 4=Armor, 5=Initiative, 6=Maneuver. The player’s value in each attribute is determined by the number of times that number was rolled on the turn. The respective results of the warriors are compared to determine if an attack hit, if damage was caused, and if dice can be rerolled. Advanced rules add specific injury results, weapons, armor, skills, magic, and ranged combat.

name: Company Commander
description:
“WWII Simulation of Combat between two infantry companies. One player represents the Americans, the other is the Germans. The Decks: The game uses 3 decks. Players share a common Tactics Deck. Each player has their own unique Squad Deck. Victory: The first player to destroy or rout 10 enemy squads or units wins. If after 2 turns, you ever have units at all three fronts and your opponent only has units at one or none, you automatically win.”

The game includes rules for recon, suppression fire, assault, flanking, and armored vehicles.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War II

name: Condottieri Captains
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Italy 1200-1550. Each player is an Italian City State. Victory: Play ends after everyone has had 10 turns. The Player with the most Provinces wins. If Provinces are tied, the tied player with the most Ducats wins. Defeat: If you are ever reduced to zero Provinces, you automatically lose. Whoever conquers your last Province gets all of your cards and Ducats."

Each player plays one of eight Italian city states and starts with five provinces, represented by five tokens. The provinces (tokens) must be captured through card play battles.

name: Conquest of Canaan
description:
“Canaan circa 1300 – 1100 BC. Each player represents one Nation vying for control of Canaan (Palestine.) The land of Canaan is represented by a pool of 20 City Tokens. Tokens (of a different color) are also used to keep track of Armies. Each Army Token a player owns generates 1 Force in the Conquest Phase. Each Army Token roughly represents 1,000 men. Victory: At the end of 20 turns, the player with the most City Tokens wins.”

Each player plays one of seven nations of the ancient Middle East. Each nation has a special ability. Through card play the players fight battles to gain control of Canaan.

This is a free game which requires paper, pencil, and your own created cards, maps, tokens, and dice. Directions for play are on the Warp Spawn Games website. Create your own game and place the images with the link below!

name: Cosmosis
description: A card game themed around celestial bodies. The object of the game is to be the first player to score 100 points playing combos. The game uses a custom card deck that includes six kinds of cards: Active Galaxy, Galaxy, Stellar Object, Main Sequence Star (MSS), Planet, and Special cards. There are a number of different combo hands that may be played. You score one point for each card in your combo.

name: Crecy
description: “Simulation of the Battle of Crecy 1346 (Hundred Years War.) Card Game for 2 players. One player represents the English, the other the French. Victory: The game lasts 16 Turns (Charges/Hands.) To win the battle the French must win 4 hands in a row, or win the last Hand by double the Force of the English, otherwise the English win.” Each side has its own custom deck of cards.

name: Crimea
description:
“Simplistic Simulation of the Crimean War 1854-56. One player is the Russians. The other player is the Allies (Anglo-French). Victory: The first player to win 7 Battles is the winner. If you have ever won 3 more battles than your opponent, you win. If a player is reduced to zero Troop Tokens he loses.”

The players draw cards from a common deck. Reinforcement Cards add to your Troop Tokens. Epidemic Cards are played to eliminate your opponent’s Troop Tokens. Battles are fought with Attack, Defense, and Blunder cards.

name: Cross & Crown
description:
“Players are Royal Dukes using political, religious and military influence to gain the most economic control of a disputed region.”

The game is played on a 10x10 hex map with 20 Settlements marked on the board. Players draw counters out of a cup and place them on empty squares. The counters are affiliated with one or two types of influence: Religious, Political, and Military. Control of Settlements is established by having the most counters of one type surrounding a settlement. The game ends when there are no empty spaces left on the board.

name: Crusades
description: “Players lead rival bands of Crusaders in their efforts to conquer Palestine 1096-1271. Christendom: Players units never attack each others’ units or settlements. They can only attack Turkish troops and Turkish controlled settlements. The Turks are not controlled by any player. Crusader nationalities include: German, French, English, Byzantine. Victory: Be the player with the most Victory Points at the end of Turn 15. Victory Points are obtained by controlling settlements.”

name: Duel of Iron
description: "Civil War era tactical combat simulation. Players each control one or more Ironclads. The rules are for the basic scenario, in which one player controls the Confederate Merrimac, and one player controls the Union Monitor. Use a hex map. Indicate which spaces are land and which are water. Indicate whether water spaces are shallow or deep. Six, eight, and ten sided dice are needed. Use cardboard counters (chits) to represent the ships."

name: Egypt
description:
“Card game simulating 3000 years of rule by the Pharaohs of ancient Egypt.” There are seven kinds of cards in the deck. Each turn the players attempt to play the highest scoring meld to establish control of Egypt. A meld is two or more cards of the same type. The player who controls Egypt may then play additional melds from his hand to gain tribute points.

“The game ends after 10 turns. Each turn represents 300 years. If the deck runs out before the 10th turn, shuffle the cards and keep playing. Victory: The player with the most accumulated tribute points at the end of the game is the winner.”

name: Evolved
description:
“It took 3.5 billion years to make this game. Winning: The player with the most species at the end of the game wins.”

A game of evolution. Each player starts with a single species. The game is played on a 6x6 grid composed of three kinds of spaces: Land, Open Water, and Islands. The board is also divided into three types of zones: Arctic, Tropical, and Temperate. The game lasts for sixteen turns, with each turn representing a different Geologic Era, Period, or Epoch, from the Archean to the Quaternary.

name: Fallujah
description:
“You control a US Marine Company on Patrol in Fallujah.”

The game uses a custom deck of sixty cards. There are ten different kinds of cards in the deck: Insurgent Tactics, Insurgents, Positions, Explosives, American Tactics, Infantry, Armor, Support , Recon, and Disarm.

The player’s score is based on how many casualties are suffered by the player's Company versus the number inflicted on the enemy.

name: Fantasy Heroes
description:
The game is played with two decks – the Territory Deck and the Battle Deck.

The Territory Deck has fifteen cards, three each of five types: Castles, Mountains, Towers, Forests, and Swamps. The Battle Deck has sixty cards, which come in four different types: Heroes, Minions, Artifacts, and Spells. The Heroes and Minions are each associated with a specific type of Territory.

The object of the game is to control all of the Territory Cards.

name: Tenaha
description:
Tenaha is a somewhat unique pattern matching and hand management domino game that requires 5 sets of Double Six dominoes, a draw bag and a set of poker chips (you need around 20 of the same color/pattern per player) to play.

The poker chips are used to mark completed sets (i.e. squares) and keep score.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Star Trek Ship Engagements
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Star Trek Space Combat Theme. Each player controls 1 Ship. Victory: Destroy your opponent’s Ships."

The players share a custom card deck which contains cards representing Sensors, Weapons, Evasion, Surprise, Detection, Sabotage, Security, Shields, Critical Hits, and (of course) Engineering.

Each player picks an Empire and a Ship Class at the start of the game. There are three Empires in the game: Federation, Klingon, and Romulan. Each Empire uses different values for the Weapon, Defense, and Special cards.

The four ship classes are: Gun Ship, Frigate, Cruiser, and Capitol Ship. Each class is rated for structure points (the number of hits the ship can take) and hand size for the class.

When there are more than two players, teams can be formed.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Star Wars Fleets
description:
"Card game for 2 players. Star Wars Universe Fleet Actions. Rebel Fleet vs Imperial Fleet."

"The Decks: Each player has their own unique deck. Cards: There are 4 types of cards - Capitol Ships, Fighter Squads, Personalities (captains or pilots), Action Cards."

"Objective: Reduce your opponent to zero Fleet Points."
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Midgard Erweiterung 1: Das Solospiel
description:
The first expansion for Midgard: Das Brettspiel features solo game rules and comes with

- an additional tile
- 20 new person and 20 new building chits
- new adventures, tasks, and shadows

This expansion is print-and-play and available from https://www.phantastische-spielewelten.de/verlag/
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Vietnam Air Fury
description: A simple game of air combat over Vietnam based on the Space Fury tactical space combat rules. Statistics are given for two fighters (F-4E and Mig-17) and design rules allow the players to construct their own aircraft. The game features air-to-air combat with missiles and guns, as well as ground attack. All maneuvering is two dimensional, there are no altitude rules.

name: Seven Samurai Skirmish
description:
"Simple tactical skirmish rules. Based on the classic movie Seven Samurai." Seven Samurai and forty villagers face off against thirty-seven heavily armed bandits.

The game is played on a hex map showing the village being protected by the Samurai. The counters represent men, horses, guns, armor, and wounds.

"Victory: The Bandits win if all the Samurai are killed. The Samurai win if the Leader, lieutenants, and 15 bandits are killed. The remaining bandits will flee."
categories: Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: Atom Smashers
description: Each scientist starts with 10d6 which represent atoms placed within a particle accelerator. Scientists compete with each other by selecting from one to three atoms with differing charges to accelerate towards other player's atoms within the atom smasher. The player with the most electric charges at game's end wins.

name: Halves
description:
Players take turns adding 12 tiles of their own colour to form a single connected board. They then take turns removing tiles of their own colour. If the board is split into more than one group, the largest group only is retained. The first player to remove all of their tiles from the board wins.

Halves may be played on gamerz.net:

http://www.gamerz.net/pbmserv/List.php?Halves

and is fully described on the designer's web site:

http://cambolbro.com/games/halves/

name: Knights & Castles
description:
A card game of competing lords who must expand their control over the lands and fill their treasuries with gold.

The players acquire and support various Resources, each of which are rated for revenue, defense points, and support requirements, if any. The Resource Cards include Villages, Towns, Mines, Castles, Cities, Knights, Ships, and Trade Routes. These efforts can be aided by Leader Cards and Advancement Cards. However, Invasion, Disaster, and Event Cards can hinder a player's efforts.

The game ends when the last card is drawn from the deck. The player with the most gold wins.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Piratical
description:
"Players control Pirate ships in search of plunder & adventure. Victory: The first player to accumulate 100 Gold is the winner."

Players move their ships around a circular ring of 48 spaces. The starting space is Port Royal, a safe zone. The other spaces consist of areas at sea or merchant ships. Merchant ships can be plundered for goods, which are exchanged for gold in port. Certain spaces cause turns to be lost, others call for a card draw.

The players face warships, weather, and other hardships. Players can also battle one another when they land on the same space, which can lead to a boarding action.

name: High Seas Fleet
description:
"Simple World War I Naval Combat rules. Map, counters, and dice game." Played on a hex map showing sea and land hexes.

Scale: The rules specify that each hex is 600 feet across (one Nautical mile = 10 hexes), each round is one minute, and each counter is one ship.

The players alternate moving one ship at a time. The players may have any of their ships fire some or all of their guns at any time. A gun battery can only be fired once per turn. When all ships have moved once, the round ends.

Statistics, including unit costs, are included for over twenty ships and submarines of the British and German fleets, as well as for shore batteries and mine fields. The rules cover factors such as anti-submarine warfare, aircraft, aircraft carriers, hidden u-boat movement, and torpedoes.

name: Lawrence of Arabia
description:
"Card Game for 2+ players. Each player represents an incarnation of Lawrence of Arabia. Players recruit Arab allies and use them to attack the Turks. Victory: The first player to have Mission cards in his Victory pile with a total Force Rating of 40 or more wins."

The game uses a custom deck of cards. There are five types of cards in the deck: Events, Leaders, Tribesmen, Missions, Defenses. The players put Leader cards into play in order to recruit Tribesmen. Leaders and Tribesmen are assigned to complete missions on Mission Cards. Defense cards are played against other players. Each time a Leader and his band are used for a mission, there is a chance they may disband and be removed from the player's control after the mission has been completed.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War I

name: Megiddo 1918
description:
"WWI card game for 2 players. Recreate the last great cavalry campaign in history. One player is the British. The other player is the Turks."

Each player uses a custom card deck composed of the following types of cards: Cavalry, Infantry, Artillery, Planes, Machine Guns, Supply, Leader, and Nuisance Cards. Battles are resolved in a series of phases: Air Strike, Cavalry Exploitation, Artillery, Machine Gun, and Infantry. The player who wins each battle scores a Victory Point.

"Victory: The British win with 5 Victory points. This indicates that they have overrun the Turks, and that they have captured Damascus before their Arab allies led by Colonel Thomas Edward Lawrence, also known as Lawrence of Arabia. The Turks win with 3 Victory points. This indicates that the Turks have made a successful fighting withdrawal and that they have retreated back to Turkey without being overrun."

name: Blood and Bronze
description:
Set firmly in Greek legend, Blood and Bronze mixes roleplaying and boardgaming aspects to make competitive and strategic 1-2 hour game. Each player acts as one of the cities of Greek legend using alliances, treachery, accusations and boasts all feature as the cities strive to be remembered as the greatest in all of Greece. To win the game strive to become dominate, called "Without Peer!" in 3 of four arenas: Army, Hero, King and God. If by the end of the agreed playing time no player has won, then the Game is said to have been won by those upstart Romans.

This game is described by the publisher as "much more a boardgame kind of thing than a role-playing game." Others have tried using the term "resource management game" to avoid both the board and RPG labels. It is available in both regular edition, with cardboard chits, and the Without Peer! edition that has bronze coins and a brass bowl.

The original version of the game was an entry in the 2005 Iron Game Chef RPG Game design competition This version is still a hybrid game but more towards the role-playing end of the spectrum than the final product.

name: Alles auf Angriff
description:
Alles auf Angriff is a soccer card game about "Die Wilden Fußballkerle". They are the main characters of a famous soccer book series for children.

The player tries to get 5 cards at first: 4 player cards and 1 trainer card.

The player can display one player card, get one card from an opponent or start an offense in order to get one player card from the opponent.

Luck and bluffing will pave the way to success.

name: Lex'-i-con
description:
This game almost mirrors that of Balderdash, but was published about 9 years prior. The game play is the same in that one player reads a word and the others try to fake out everyone by writing down a fictional definition. Points are awarded when others pick yours as the correct definition.

This may be one of the first packagings of the old Dictionary Game.

name: The Great Space Race
description:
"Race to the moon and back as the United States of America and the Soviet Union compete for International prestige. The game starts in the late 1950's and spans 3 decades. It attempts to simulate the economy, the military, and the scientific community as they play crucial roles in the race to the moon. This is only a game but the events contained herein are real. You'll experience the frustrations of failure and the joys of success as we take you back in time into the Great Space Race."

The game board depicts a track 30 spaces long. The object is to be the first player to get to the moon (space 30) and return back to Earth (space 1). The game also uses a deck of Launch Cards broken down into three groups reflecting events of the fifties, sixties, and seventies.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Print & Play, Space Exploration

name: Man Hunt
description:
Title: Man Hunt, by Parker Brothers, circa 1937.

The following information is summarized from the game rules.

The Idea of The Game

Each player is an agent in pursuit of a criminal. By means of clues furnished on the cards and in the envelopes you may, by the use of a little judgment, be the first to catch your criminal and earn the major portion of the reward. For two to six players.

Equipment

1 Game board - An outline map of the United States, showing the names of states, cities, and routes of travel that must be used when traveling from one city or state to another.

6 Different colored Pins- Used to represent each player.

24 Biographical cards- Each showing a sketch and biographical information on a separate criminal.

A few examples of biographical cards include a few BLACK AMERICANA cards:

"LUCKY" HAMES, WANTED for holdup and robbery in Jackson, Miss., on April 5, 1936. Age 31, Height 5 ft. 7 inches. Weight 136 lbs. Eyes maroon, complexion black. Hair usually close cut. If arrested notify police at Jackson, Miss.

"WHITEY" COLLINS, WANTED for murder of white man in Dallas, Texas, on February 8, 1934. Age 33, Colored, Height 5 feet 7 inches. Weight 155 lbs. Hair black and kinky, eyes maroon, complexion full black. If arrested notify Police Department of Dallas, Texas.

"TOMBSTONE" THOMPSON, WANTED for hold-up and robbery of a woman in Abilene, Texas, on Sept. 30, 1936. Age 31, Height 5 feet 9 inches; Weight 165 lbs. Very prominent front teeth---one gold. Typical field hand, close cropped hair. Scar under right eye. If arrested communicate with Police, Abilene, Texas.

"MIDNIGHT" JOHNSON, WANTED in Atlanta, Georgia, for slashing another negro with razor, in fight over crap game, Dec. 31, 1936. Age 31, Height 5 feet 7 inches, Weight 145 lbs., Sporty dresser, black, short, fairly straight hair. Scar on nose. Hold and notify Atlanta Police.

24 Envelopes bearing each criminals name - Each envelope contains either four or five clues to assist in tracking the criminal and trace his movements.

2 dice - Used to determine player movement.

160 Bills - Paper money in denominations of $100, $50, $20, and $10.

To Start

Each player is given $1000.00 and puts $500.00 into a pool which is set aside to serve as reward money. Players then randomly choose a criminal to track. Opposing players then are provided the clue envelopes for their opponent's criminal. Players then place their pin on the map where their criminal is wanted. Highest roll of the dice goes first.

The Play

Players then attempt to track their criminal first by reading the biographical card, and judging what location the next clue to his whereabouts may be obtained. Dice are then rolled to determine the distance the player can move, the full amount of two dice for air travel, the large number of the two for express train, or the smaller number of the two dice for automobile. Upon arrival at his destination he will ask the player holding his clue envelope if a clue is found at the location. If no clue is found he must return to the city he started from, or last city where he obtained a clue. Players may also send other players on missions to uncover clues for them. If the player being sent refuses the mission he must pay $100 into the reward pool. If he goes on the mission and uncovers a clue for another player he will receive $50 from that player. If no clue is uncovered, the player sending him on the mission pays $50 to the reward pool.

The final clue will advise of the death or capture of the criminal.The first player to uncover all of the clues for his criminal receives $1000, the second to finish $800, and third $600, and any players after $500, or until the reward pool money is exhausted. The player with the most reward money at the end is the winner.

name: Rose Bowl Computerized Football
description: The offense calls out one of 14 plays. Players then consult a shared Play Chart with 15 result columns to determine their desired result and then select one of 8 values in their "analog computer" -- a box with two selector wheels and a result window. The result (the sum of the 2 numbers) is display by opening a window to a 3rd door in the computer. Players view play result on the Play Chart and move the ball on the field contained in the game box. A quarter is equivalent to 15 plays.

name: Bitva
description:
Bitva (in English "Battle") is a light abstract wargame, played on a hex grid. This game is playable either as a 2-player or a 4-player game in two variations - an easier game with less options or more difficult (in a manner) with more options and restrictions on movement/opponent elimination.

You basically roll two 6-sided dice and them can jump with one of your soldiers from the field numbered on either the first/second die to a field numbered on the second/first die.

Example: you roll 2 and 6 and therefore you can jump from 2 to 6 or from 6 to 2 (you are not allowed to jump 2 to another 2 or 6 to another 6) if your soldier stands in a formation (2 soldiers on adjacent hexes). If you land on a square with your opponent, you eliminate him from the board. If your soldier stands as a single unit, he can only jump onto an adjacent hex (providing appropriate numbers have been rolled).

There is also one general per side which can jump on any appropriately numbered hex even if he does not stand in a formation. He also has 2 (or just 1 in case of 4 players) "Home hexes" where no soldier can attack him unless all other soldiers of the general's side are dead already.

When the enemy general is removed from game, the game ends.

In the advanced game there is an inner area which is used for elimination. The outer area is a no-fighting zone (cover).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Imperial Ambitions
description:
"A simple space combat system featuring individual ships in large fleet strategic combat operations."

"The game is played in two parts, on two different maps. The Strategic Game is played only on the strategic map, and the Tactical Game, where battles are fought, is played only on the tactical battle maps."

"In the Strategic Game, units move from one star system to another, and construction, repairs and various economic functions are conducted."

"At the end of the Strategic Sequence of Play, any hexes containing opposing units on the strategic map may trigger a battle (at the discretion of either one of the players with forces in the same hex), at which point each battle is resolved on a tactical map using the Tactical Game."

name: Market
description:
A type of poker game which involves bidding on cards
Each player will bid with a limited amount of money on faceup cards for his hand. At the end of the round, who ever has the highest hand wins. The hand rankings are as follows:
1 pair
3 card straight
3 card flush
2 pair
3 card straight-flush
4 card straight
4 card flush
3 of a kind
5 card straight
5 card flush
full house
double 3-of-a-kind
four of a kind
5 card straight flush

name: The Gettysburg Campaign
description:
Recreates Robert E Lee's 1863 invasion of Pennsylvania using the same block game system as Worthington's previous Civil War game Forge in Fire. The game will cover the historic campaign through June and July. The Confederate player will play Lee while the Union player will play Union Commanders Joe Hooker and then George Meade. The goal of the Confederates is to capture certain import areas including if possible such cities as Baltimore and Washington.

The game itself uses a classic block game system. Strategic level play takes place on a point to point map of the Maryland and Pennsylvania countryside. Once combat is joined players will switch their counters to a battle board to conduct the tactical level combat. The units themselves are classic block game counters with a unit's strength being designated by numbers on the outside of the block which can be rotated to reflect losses in combat.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Conniption
description:
From the publisher's website:

You'll be having conniption fits when the playing board is flipped upside down. Watch closely as the colored disks start tumbling into new color sequences. Will they land in winning color combinations for you, or for your opponent? Yikes!

In turn, players drop their discs down the vertical slots. But first, they must decide to flip the board before, or after, they play, creating brand new disk dilemmas.

Flip your way to 4 in a row to win.

name: Fab's Quiz
description:
Initially created as a joke for my girlfriend's birthday, this trivia game is real fun to play.

The game is played in teams of two players each.

One team is selected to start playing and then the game is played clock-wise.

At a team’s turn, a dice is rolled and the counter representing the team is moved half of the dice result.

Then a card is drawn and the team has to answer a question about my girlfriend (may be adapt to any person you want prior to play).

If the team answers correctly to the question, it may advance again its counter based on the result of a new dice roll.

The better you know the person, the quicker you will advance in the game.

The team that finishes first after three complete board turns is the winner of the game, and receives a "Very Best Friend Diploma".

Some special cards will add unexpected events as they are drawn :-)
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Privateers
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Latter half of the Seventeenth Century. Players are European Nations employing Privateers to attack each other’s shipping."

"In this era, only about 20% of a Nations Fleet would be Crown property, the remainder were privately owned ships, that when they were not augmenting the Battle Line, were permitted to do Commerce raiding on their own."

Each player chooses to play one of four nations: Spain, England, France, or Holland. The custom card deck includes nine types of cards: Ships, Captains, Crews, Bases, Escorts, Merchants, Treasures, Defenses, and Events.

The object of the game is to be the first player to amass 100 gold.

name: Worms
description:
Worms is a Board Game inspired by the Team17 game of the same name. It brings the strange combination of utter
silliness and tactics from the computer game to the table top.
Worms is game for two to four players and usually on takes about 10 minutes to play. Each player controls one team
of four combat ready Worms. Each worm comes equipped with a variety of weapons from the lowly Pistol to the
awesome and lethal Sheep. (copied from the rulebook)

(Not available online at this time)
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kenefick
description:
Kenefick is a non-partnership climbing card game combining various elements from Zheng Fen, Big Two, Poker, and Hearts.

Distinctive features: Deck includes two jokers, which function as wild cards if used in card combinations and the highest card combination if used together. Players score points for going out, and for collecting 10s, Js, Qs, and Ks. Combinations include singles, pairs, two pairs, three of a kinds, straights, flushes, full houses, four of a kinds, straight flushes, and bombs. Play of a trick always starts as a single card, but can always be trumped up to a higher ranked card combination.

name: The All New Dating Game
description:
Which players will be paired off as the most "date-able" couples? You'll find out in this unique home adaptation of television's popular game show of dates and mates!

First players secretly write down their answers to questions, and then they vote on the ones they liked best. When all the votes are tallied, players are revealed to each other and the matchmaking begins!
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Oh la l'Art
description:
From the box:
"An amusing, competitive game for all the family. A new game based on a familiar idea.

"Have a lot of laughs! A competitive game focusing on 3 key figures to be completed for bonus points, while each player assembles as many sets as possible.

"The game includes:
- 27 Head cards
- 27 Torso cards
- 27 Foot cards
- A poster containing 27 full color reproductions presenting the complete works of art and their creators.
- Instruction sheet with rules of the game."

About the game:
Players try to assemble complete figures based on famous works of art by making sets of heads, torsos and legs/feet. Bonus points are given to the player who can completely assemble the three figures in the middle of the table.

name: Hell's Foxes
description:
Hells Foxes is a board game of the North African Campaign of World War II conducted between the Axis forces of Germany and Italy and the Allied forces of United Kingdom - England, Australia, New Zealand, India, South Africa, France, Poland, Jewish Battalion, from the Spring of 1941 until the winter of 1942.
COMPONENTS


1 "Rules Book" consisting with a Light BLUE 'cover' which contains some "Errata", and inside 16 pages of "Rules", while the BACK 'cover' has some "Charts" and other *Notes*.
4 Paper MAPS 11 X 16 Black on White printed with "Graphic" renditions displaying the "Terrain" from its 'genre' for "WW-2 North Africa Campaigns" at the time of publication. Adjoin these in correct 'order' from 1 to 4 and secure properly, such as with taping it down, or placing "perspex" / "plexiglas" for that.
3 Small Label Sheets with Front & Back images comprising:
(1) of RED print for "Axis"
(1) of BLUE print for "Allied"
(1) of GREEN print for BOTH to use as "Game Markers".

name: Speedway Racing
description:
(from their website)

Calling All Race Fans
CATCH THE EXCITEMENT OF "BIG TIME AUTO RACING"!

If you love stock car racing, you must play Speedway Racing's board game. The Speedway Racing board game gives you 'big time stock car auto racing' and 'live event track action' for true, behind the wheel racing experiences.

At the Drivers Meeting, you will receive your Drivers Handbook and will learn the rules of the race.
With one to five drivers, choose your favorite car, then 'start your engines'. Drivers race their cars around the oval track based on a roll of the dice. There are Bonus Points in the game. If you are lucky enough to roll doubles or other combinations imprinted, on the Speedway Racing game board, you will accelerate your advancement around the track.

During the Driver's meeting, you also learn that this will be a fast paced, five-lap competition. You will be driving against other highly competitive opponents. There are many Challenges and Pitfalls ahead of you as you speed around the track to take your car, to the coveted "Winner Circle", of Speedway Racing's board game.

Before you begin, choose Option 1, for the first driver to cross the finish line. Or, Option 2, in case all drivers are 'stacked up' and trying to cross the finish line. One last roll of the dice will determine the winner. You must choose Option 1 or Option 2, before the race begins.

The Race is Underway! Of course, the object of the game is to win the race, but beware; there are advantages and obstacles as you thunder around the track.

Hit the "Pit Stop" Zone or the "Speedway Challenge" Zone and adjust your position based on the events of each opportunity. Hit the wall and you suffer the consequences, in your quest. If you can avoid an accident, you will advance your position on the track.

Take care in selecting your pit crew. Many track advantages will depend on the timing, action and reaction speed of your pit crew.A driver can pilot the race car, but the pit crew will make the crucial difference in the outcome of the victory.

As in real speedway racing, your pit crew is vital! The Speedway Racing Board Game track graphics are beautifully illustrated. The game's race cars are authentic 1:144 scale die-cast metal with moving wheels.

The "Challenge" cards and "Pit Stop" cards are
realistic 'during the race' events. As you position your car and maneuver around the track, you will encounter cars hitting the wall, track debris, flat tires and yellow flags.

Caution Flags Are Out! Beware of Hazards!!

White-knuckle rookie drivers could hit the car in front of them, have stalled engines or make serious driving errors, while lapped traffic slows you down. The events of the "Speedway Racing" board game will impact the sheer adrenaline rush of moving forward, as you concentrate, on the coveted first place win. As you cross the Finish Line, move your car into the "Winner's Circle".

Each game contains a highly detailed graphic game board, five 1:144 scale die-cast cars with moving wheels, drivers challenge cards, dice and directions, in a re-usable bag. Family board game enthusiasts may want to have multiple games for their weekly or monthly family board game night.

The rules, of this family board game, are easy enough for the youngest race fans, but challenging enough, to keep you and the other drivers ever watchful on the track.

name: Country Club Golf
description: The object of the game is to play a round of golf in an attempt to par the course, just as you would on any golf course around the world. The game is designed to bring to some degree, the same enjoyment received in actual play. Since luck and skill are a part of each round played at your favorite golf course, luck and skill (in rolling the dice) await you as you enter the Country Club course, with its water and sand hazards.

name: Da' Pres
description:
Card Game about becoming president. Includes cards for every state. Has cards about different things you can do to become president, such as "Raise Taxes", "Decrease Welfare" , "Increase Defense Budget" , "Protect Natural Resources".
Full game: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

name: The Auction Game
description: Players each receive 10 counters with which to buy cards. The card deck, which consists of 24 pairs of cards, each card representing half of an article, is dealt out evenly. Each of the 24 articles fits into a category of animal, vegetable, or mineral. To start, all players look at their cards and place (face down) any pairs they may already have. They then use their counters to buy cards that other players are auctioning. Players take turns being the auctioneer. At the end of the game you want to have the most pairs. If the number of pairs is tied, the tie is broken by the number of coins.

name: Basic Tactics
description:
Basic Tactics is a fast paced variation on the traditional card game of War, but with some strategic decisions. For 2 players.

You get: A one-page folded sheet with rules for the game on it, printed on parchment like paper.

You need: 1 standard deck of 52 cards (jokers optional) and a friend to play with.

name: Capture
description: Capture is a card game for 2 players. You must capture more cards than the other player by the end of one play through the deck. Play proceeds via 5 columns in a round. If you have the best scoring hand in a column, you get all the cards in it.

name: Slyderz
description: This is a cross between Checkers and Sorry. It should be real easy for little kids to play. Basically you have to eliminate all your opponents pieces off the board. Each Player has 12 pieces that he/she can maneuver across a 4 piece map/board. The pieces have different movement patterns (like chess).

name: SHRINE
description: Shrine is a playing card game in which the objective is to remove all cards from the other player’s Shrine in order to win the game. During the play of the game, players may add cards to their Shrine, remove cards from the other player’s Shrine and play special cards and combos to help them win the game. Shrine uses a regular 52 card poker deck with an optional joker.

name: Galactic Hero
description:
“You are a brave pilot battling against enemy ships from another world. You must use your skill and cunning to survive not only the threat from enemy forces but also the evil alien race known as the Bogons.”

2 to 6 Players can play this simple, and fun, card game. Have you got what it takes to become a Galactic Hero?

The files needed to make this Print and Play Card Game can be purchased from http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=662&;pics
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: The Faraway Tree Card Game
description: A card game for little children based on the Faraway Tree books by Enid Blyton. Consists of 44 cards featuring characters familiar to fans of the books. The object of the game is be the first to complete the story of The Faraway Tree by playing cards numbered 1 through 9. There are penalty cards to play against your opponents to try and slow them down.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Farmyard Cries
description:
A card game with 44 animal cards divided into 7 sets. Each set has a "Mother" card, 1 or more "young" cards, 1 or more "Where Found" cards, and 1 or more "breed" cards. The cards of each set have the same number on them. This number is the points you earn by collecting that particular set.

The object of each round is to collect 1 "Mother", 1 "young", 1 "breed", and 1 "Where Found" card from any given set. The first player to do this wins any given round and receives the points shown on that set.

The fun part for little children comes in when a player has managed to collect a "Mother", a "breed" and a "where found" card for one set. At this point that player "cries" for the young by making the sound of that animal. The idea here is that the mother of the set is calling out for her young. When this happens, any player in possession of "young" cards of that specific animal type must give them to the crying player.

The first player to 60 points wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Wratismania
description: Wratismania is an educational boardgame made by Polish artist. His purpose was to teach people about Wroc≈Çaw -- a Polish city, the capital of Lower Silesia. Players are moving on the map using three methods of communication: by bus, by taxi and on foot. By visiting various places they collect cards with brief description of place. The player who will get the most cards, wins.

name: Quiz 2000
description:
Trivia game made by MB.
Similar to Trivial Pursuit (same questions categories), if a roll and move game on a solar system. You might to collect all the planets (like Mercury, Venus,...) and arrive to the end of the table.

Components:

252 Question Cards (quiz 2000 cards,general question)
200 Question Cards (planets cards)
6 Player piece
36 Planets Rings
1 Rule Book

name: Points Total
description:
A very simple game from PyroMyth Games. 1 page of rules, 1 page with the board and tiles on it. Each player receives 4 tiles. These tiles have arrows pointing different directions and a point value. After a player places a tile they score their points for that play. Points are totaled by adding the value of the tile plus the value of the board position or tile if it has been played on that every arrow on their tile points to.

Full Game: http://www.pyromythgames.com/offerings/freegames/freegames.h...

name: Indivisible
description:
Object: To claim opponent’s cards by determining the number of a given card in their hand.

Every turn a card will be turned face up and each player will announce how many cards in their hand can be divided evenly into it. These cards should be put in separate piles by rank so everyone can see what has been draw through out the game. If a player has no cards that can be evenly divided into it they announce Indivisible.

Starting with the player with the coin and continuing clockwise each player may attempt (but is not required) to guess one other players cards. The need to tell what card they are looking for and how many that player has in their hand. Guessing 0 is not valid. If they are correct in guessing both the rank of the card and how many the guessing player gets that card/s and places them face up in front of them for scoring at the games end. If they are wrong they must discard one card from their hand face up onto the common piles. When a player has no more cards in their hand they may no longer guess and are out until scoring.

Full Rules: http://www.pyromythgames.com/offerings/freegames/indivisible...

name: Pentaplane
description:
Pentaplane is a three-dimensional board (five stacked 5x5 square grids) on which several games can be played:


Pentaplane-Aircraft. A "rudimentary" game (the designer's word) in which each player controls a single piece representing an airplane and attempts to shoot down the opponent. Moves are plotted in groups of five. The planes move the same as the rooks do in the later games.



Pentaplane-Checkers. This is played much like standard checkers, but the pieces move diagonally between boards, not on the same board. Some spaces on the boards have dots to facilitate diagonal movement, which is always from dot to dot or blank to blank.



Pentaplane-Chess. This has a number of differences from standard Chess besides the board. There are no kings of queens, instead there are monarchs, and they can only be obtained by promoting pawns. Pawns can move backwards as well as forwards. The bishops move the same way as the pieces in Pentaplane-Checkers.



Super Pentaplane-Chess. Pentaplane-Chess but with a much greater variety of pieces: a president which can move along flat diagonals, a hopper which must jump over another piece when moving, missile versions of pieces which can destroy other pieces at a distance, bomb versions of pieces which can blow up and destroy a 3x3x3 area, etc. Players agree on which pieces are allowed before the game. They do not have to use the same set of pieces. Note that the new pieces introduced here are not included in the Pentaplane set.



Pentaplane V. This game is not included in the rulebook, but is available online (see the Links section). This is a modified version of Super Pentaplane-Chess with some differences in the list of pieces.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Kino Reise-Edition
description:
A cinema-themed travel version of Trivial Pursuit, the most sold trivia game of all times. Can be played by 2 persons allone in the backseat of a car or in 2 teams (left and right side of a travelbus was nice :) )
Comes in a nice rigid plastic container.

name: KABILA Genial
description:
It's a game of mental agility and competition which objective is to accumulate the most points along the 20 rounds.
Each round has two different games, the first one called "Prueba de vocabulario" (vocabulary test) in which players will have to find the longest word using 9 given letters. Players randomly draw letter tiles asking for either a vowel or a consonant, there are also some "joker" cards that can work as any letter. The second game is called "Prueba de cálculo" (math test) in which players will have to get as close as possible to a number generated randomly with 3 dices (number between 1 to 999) using for it just 6 numbers. Players randomly draw number tiles asking for either a unit (1-9) or a decimal (10-90).

Allows from 2 to 6 players (12 if played in teams).

name: Summum
description:
Summum is an abstract strategy game for 2 persons. The players take turns placing pieces on the colorful board trying to form one of three patterns. Players have to decide whether to score points or prevent the opponent for scoring points.
When one of the three patterns is formed the player scores points based on the pattern and the color of the rectangle on which the last piece of the pattern is placed.
The game ends when both players played their last piece.
The kings on the side of the board keep track of the score.

Contents
36 white pieces
36 black pieces
2 kings
1 board
rules

For more infomation visit: http://www.magi-games.nl/sum/index_sum.html (Dutch)

name: Les fractions
description:
The box contains two dices with ratios on their faces, several coloured sectors of disk; and rings which you can clip the sectors onto. The different proportions used are : 1/2 ; 1/3 ;1/4 ; 1/6 and 1/8.

At his turn, each player throws the two ratio dices and picks up the disks sectors accordingly to the results. Then he tries to arrange those sectors around his rings, in order to form two perfect circles, and wins if he succeeds in this task. Otherwise, the winner is he who has the most rings completes, or else the most sectors.

Three different variants of growing difficulties are proposed, allowing players to make use of different levels of math abilities from adding fractions to basic probabilities.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Dragon's Journey: A Race to Save the Magic
description:
Imagine a world where the Magic is dying. Where dragons and wizards are forced into hiding as their numbers dwindle. But the Spirit of Magic gives a final push to save itself and six brightly colored dragon babies are born to powerful parents. All the creatures in Ohadi, a magical land of majestic mountains, rolling rivers and forbidden forests, must work together to teach the babies their dragon skills before the Magic disappears forever.

Be the first dragon to earn all 5 Dragon Skill cards, receive a dragon name, collect each of the 3 treasures from the King's Castle, and return to the cave.

Each player plays a dragon moving around the board collecting various items and avoiding spaces that deter progress.

name: Brigade de recherches
description:
Box contents: 1 board, 48 “clue” cards, 4 “chief of brigade” pawns, 4 “gendarme pawns”, 4 declaration notebooks (each describing 8 criminal cases), 4 “memento” cards, 12 “witness clue” tokens.
The 12 witness clues are set upon their board spaces, then the players moves their chief and gendarme in order to collect the six clues of their criminal case, and to get back first to their headquarters.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Hvad er det v√¶rd?
description: How much is it worth? is a game based on the danish tv-program also called How much is it worth?. It's a game where you place a bid on antique products that have been found in places in Denmark. You should also pick-up tiles and select 3 of a kind.

name: Kubus Fugus
description:
Kubus Fugus consists of 30 wooden cubes (4 cm / 1.6 inch). Each cube has the same 6 different patterns on its sides, but no two cubes have the same arrangement of these six sides. The sides have dots or lines in different patterns, carved into the wooden surfaces.

Each player "owns" a type of side, e.g. the "cross" or the "four dots" and places one cube on his turn onto the 5 x 6 grid board, starting from a corner. There are only a few rules:

1. Placing a cube, the sides surface-to-surface to another cube has to have the same pattern.

2. This also applies, if the cube has to fit in between two or three cubes already placed, thus limiting the possibilities.

3. It is forbidden to place a cube in a way, that an adjacent cube cannot be placed. SO, sides facing a "spare" place are not allowed to be the same.

4. There may not occur any "holes" on the board, so the whole grid is filled up slowly.

Since you have to draw your next cube randomly, there is a "luck factor", for the limitations in placement can be huge or non-existent.

Scoring:
If the grid is filled up - or cannot be filled any further - the sides showing upside are counted for each player. The player with the most sides showing up is the winner.

There are a lot of puzzles, too, for the 1-player-variant, and 3D-variants.

One special thing about this game is, that you can also play it blindfold or with blind people.

name: Blue Water Navies
description:
Rules for all aspects of naval warfare from 1910 to 1945.

These rule are designed to provide an historical and quick playing game on a 4' by 8' or smaller table. While designed for 1:2400 scale models, any scale can be used.

The distance scale is 1' equals = 3 mile. Distances are given in inches. If space is a problem, centimeters.

Ships for all major combatants of this era have been included in one of the Fleet Registries.

The Fleet Registries contains all the data required to play this game. Players should use this information when ever possible. However, many ships during the course of their life would under go changes. The Fleet Registries contains data on only one point of time for each class. Players should allow other versions of the ships provided they can be documented.

Contains:
Rules
WWI Fleet Registry
WWII Fleet Registry
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Robbies Tafel Avontuur
description: This is an educational game designed to help children learn their multiplication tables. The board has a number of spaces in a single path. Players roll the die and must undertake any tasks in the space they land on. These may be running from nasty hounds, or drawing a card and answering the math question. First player to the end wins.

name: The Liners
description: Starting with a 737 players attempt to build a profitable airline in a variable economic situation. A short one page economic game for 1-2 players.

name: Loigny
description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº6.

Battle of the Franco-Prussian war.

name: Biz-bluff
description:
Contents: a board representing a town, 4 coloured pawns, 4 credentials cards, 12 business folders, 20 “biz-bluff” cards, a dice.
Players sell and buy stocks, trying to earn as much as possible from opponents, and of course, to be the wealthier at the end of the game. Pawns movements are decided by the dice, and so are the cards to be drawn, but it is mainly a game of bluff and memory.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Las Vegas Fortune
description:
Monopoly clone with Las Vegas gambling elements added.

From the publisher's website:

Competition is tough on Las Vegas Boulevard, and it will take a lot more than luck to build your fortune in this town. This game has all the action of a traditional property trading game, with an exciting NEW poker twist where players build their fortune interacting with each other playing blackjack, roulette & dice games. Plus race against each other, to buy and develop your Casino and Resort properties. Who knows you might even hit the jackpot! The wealthiest gambler at the end of the game wins!!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Office Dodger
description:
Bluffing card game about white collar workers fooling around at work.
One player is designated as the boss and the rest as workers. Each turn, workers choose a card representing their slacking (for points). Then the boss chooses one of those cards to flip over. If you are caught slacking you get no points and may even swap rolls with the boss. If the boss does not choose you, then you will get 1 or 2 points. The winner is he or she that makes 15 points first.

name: Yom-Kippur, Sinai-73
description:
It represents the fight between Arab and Israeli in the front of Sinai, during the Yom Kippur war, 1973.
Map 297x420mm and 96 counters.

Game included with Alea Magazine nº3.

name: Europe at War
description:
"War in Europe in the 18th & 19th Centuries." The players take control of one of the following armies: French, British, Prussian, Austrian, or Russian. The object of the game is to control the most territories at the end of the game.

Components include an area movement map of Europe circa 1700-1800, a deck of Action Cards with events tailored to the historical period, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: War of Independence
description:
A game of the American Revolutionary War, 1775-1783. One player controls the American forces and the other player controls the British forces. The object of the game is to control the most territories at the end of the game, or to destroy all opposing units.

Components include an area movement map of the thirteen American colonies (and a portion of Canada), a deck of Action Cards with events tailored to the historical period, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Union & Confederacy
description:
A game of the American Civil War, 1860-1865. One player controls the Union forces and the other player controls the Confederate forces. The Union player must eliminate all Confederate units or occupy over half of the Confederate states to win, otherwise the Confederate player wins.

Components include an area movement map of North America circa 1860, a deck of Action Cards with events tailored to the historical period, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Satan's Folly
description:
"A simulation of the War in Heaven from John Milton's Paradise Lost. In it, the forces of Satan fight the forces of God in a battle for control of Heaven before the Son defeats them and they are cast out of Heaven and into Hell."

The game is based on Books V and VI of Paradise Lost. The Satan player must destroy a certain number of Heaven's forces to win the game. The Force of Good player wins by preventing Satan from achieving his victory conditions.

name: Rules of War
description:
"Generic Rules for Combat in any scale or era."

A universal and generic wargaming system for recreating battles from all eras, and from fiction, using a hex map, counters, and dice.

Unit stats are included for World War I, World War II, Napoleonic campaigns, Feudal Japan, the Middle Ages, and science fiction spacecraft.

In addition, there are army lists for Middle Earth conflicts as depicted in Lord of the Rings and Star Wars spaceship battles.
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Rules of War: Ancient Period
description:
A generic rules set for recreating ancient battles on a variety of scales.

"The basic concept is to be able to have: Relatively quick battles with 20-30 units to a side. A minimum of record keeping. Easy set up. A very simple rules-system, easily learned, and easily modified."

Contains Army Lists for the Greeks, Persians, Macedonians, Indians, Carthaginians, Romans, Gauls, Celts, and Huns.

name: Maori Wars
description:
"Card game for 2 players. Theme: New Zealand Maori Wars 1840-1872. One player is the Pakehas (White Men). The other player is the Native Maori."

The game uses a set of 19 Land Tokens and two custom decks of cards - a Maori Deck and a Pakehas Deck. There are nine different types of cards, each named for aspects of the conflict (Leaders, Tactics, Weapons, Politics, Morale, Defenses, etc.) Each card is ranked with a Strength value from 2 to 5.

Each hand the players battle for the possession of a single Land Token. Tokens are won by playing a set of cards having a higher total Strength value than those played by the opponent. The first player to acquire ten Land Tokens wins the game.

name: First Settlement
description:
"The game is a simulation of the hardships faced by the first English Colonists to the New World in the 1600s. Each player controls their own colony, modeled after Jamestown, the Plymouth Pilgrims, and the Boston Puritans." The game consists of six card decks: a Leader Deck, Site Deck, Action Deck, Build Deck, Food Deck, and Hardships Deck.

"The game lasts 5 years. This represents the first 5 years of each players colony. Each Season is a turn, so the game runs for 20 turns."

"Victory: The player with the most Victory Points (VP) at the end of the game wins." Victory Points are scored for the number of Colonist Tokens, Land Purchase Tokens, and Buildings a player possesses at the end of the game.

name: Spanish Empire
description: "The Spanish Empire: 15-18th Centuries. Each player is a Noble Family in Spain, trying to serve the Crown by arranging the loans and manpower to fight the Wars and Discover, conquer, and exploit new lands in the name of Empire."

name: Land War in Asia
description:
"War in Ancient China." The players take control of one of the following ancient armies: Chou, Ch'in, Han, Hsiung-Nu, Korean, or Central Asian. The object of the game is to capture all territories and eliminate all opposing units.

Components include an area movement map of China, a deck of Action Cards, and a set of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Chakras
description:
A card game themed around the Chakras. The game uses a custom card deck consisting of 49 cards in seven suits. Each suit is made up of seven cards, one for each Chakra.

The players score points by playing a combos. There are five types of combos, each of which scores either 3 or 7 Chakra Points. The winner is the player who has scored the most Chakra Points after seven combos have been played.

name: WWE Power 25 DVD Board Game
description:
From the packaging:

Think you know WWE?

Prove yourself in an extreme battle to become the No. 1 ranked Superstar in WWE. Watch and answer 5 different categories of on-screen DVD challenges featuring all of your favorite WWE Superstars & Legends.

Synopsis:
Answer questions presented by the DVD. Answering correctly moves you up the game board. Answering incorrectly moves you down the game board. The first player to reach the end of the board wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Brincando de Geografia
description: This game is played with forty cards, which are divided in eight groups of five cards each. Through the game of trump, where that one that plays the highest card of the subject called for by the first player takes all the cards from the table. This way participants learn by playing, which are the biggest countries, lakes, populations, islands, deserts, volcanoes and rivers of the world.

name: Sieg in Afrika
description:
Sieg in Afrika is an operational game of the campaign in North Africa from the first Italian advances in 1940 through the final battles in 1943. The players are placed in the positions of the overall theater commanders for North Africa. Each must direct the available forces of the in armored thrusts and parries across across the sands, escarpments, and mountains of Egypt, Libya, & Tunesia. Two situation maps and two sets of markers for plotting intelligence results and operation reports are provided. Two may play, or the computer will act as an opponent, capable of playing either side.
Design & art by J.Kula.

A type of game which was shortly popular with the upcoming of the home computer in the early 80's. Designers were still exploring the possibilities of uses for a home computer, and a few games have been published in that era where your computer was used as an Aide de Camp for boardgames. Avalon Hill's Tanktics is probably the best known.

Sieg in Afrika is particularly outstanding in the fact that fog of war is simulated by 2 identical maps and counter sets. Against a human player, the moves and actions are typed in the computer for resolvement purposes only. In 1 player mode, the computer also gives output on where the computer counters are placed. The software can be run on an Apple ][ or a Commodore 64.

name: Snap It Up! Word Families
description: Gather related word sets... Part of a family of educational games with a similar mechanic; although all the others are math related.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Great Wall
description: A card game whose theme is the construction of the Great Wall of China. Per the instructions, the game requires a "long playing surface" as the wall is built by playing cards side by side. The object of the game is to have the most honor points at the end of the game.

name: Battle of Changkufeng Hill 1938
description:
This is a 100 counter Japanese wargame on the Battle of Changkufeng Hill(also known as the Battle of Lake Khasan) July 29-Aug 11, 1938.

This battle was a prelude to the bigger battle of Nomonhan 1939.

11 daily turns.

Came out in Command Magazine Japan #82.

name: Passport to Australia
description: A game that sees you race around Australia, to see who can collect all the items needed and then be the first back.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Trivia

name: Transport Tycoon
description:
Created to celebrate 100 years of Ewals Cargo Care logistics.

Collect cargo from one part of Europe and deliver it to another. Increase the size of your truck, then your cargo, and build your logistics empire.

A surprisingly sophisticated game for a corporate giveaway.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Tiger Chess
description:
Tiger Chess is a game developed in ancient China, In this game; One side controls a "tiger"(a black marker) and the other side controls 12 "humans" (white makers).

On a game board of 8x8 square plus a 2x2 square (tiger cave), "humans" aim to capture the "tiger", by surrounding the "tiger" with four "humans". The "tiger" on the other hand tries to 'eat' the "humans", by simply jumping over the "human" markers, if less than four "humans" survive, the "tiger" wins the game.

Games in the Tiger Chess Family Include:

Two Tigers Chess
Three Tigers Chess

name: Hercules & Xena
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Score points for creating adventures featuring your Favorite TV Heroes."

The game uses two custom decks of cards, the Hero Deck and the Foe Deck. Each player keeps two hands of cards, a Hero Hand and a Foe Hand. The players play melds of cards which represents adventures. The score for playing a meld is equal to the sum of the value of the Foe cards played in the meld. The player with the highest score after either deck runs out wins the game.

name: Hastings
description:
"Card game for 2 Players. Simulation of the Battle of Hastings 1066 AD. William, Duke of Normandy has invaded England, defended by The Anglo-Saxon King, Harold Godwin."

Each player uses a unique deck of 63 cards. Each deck is made up of four types of cards (Leader, Unit, Weapons, and Strategy) marked with a force value from 2 to 7. The cards reflect elements of the historical campaign.

The players attempt to play the highest combined force combination on each of three fronts: Left Flank, Center Front, and Right Flank. "Victory: The First player to accumulate 5 Victory markers at any one Front wins."

name: Space Scouts
description:
"Card and Bookkeeping game. Explore the mysteries of outer space with your trusty ship and intrepid crew."

Each player rolls up a ship with six systems ("skills") and six crew members, each having a random skill or skills.

The game uses a custom deck of cards to create encounters and missions. There are four types of cards in the deck: Mission, Threat, Mishap, and Aid.

"Object: Have the most mission and threat cards in your Completion Pile by the end of the game."

Rules variants allow for solo play, replacing the card deck die roll tables, and for playing with the cards divided into three separate decks.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Stormbringer
description:
"Two player card game depicting the struggle between Law & Chaos in Moorcock’s Elric Fantasies."

The game uses two decks of cards, the Law Deck and the Chaos Deck. The players control their respective decks. Each player also starts with four Balance Tokens.

"Victory: The first player to control all 8 Balance Tokens wins the game."

name: WWI Combined Arms
description:
"Board game for 2 players. World War I theme. No dice or cards. Each unit represents a squad, gun, or vehicle."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. There are three types of terrain: Bunkers, Trenches, and No-Mans-Land.

Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. There are eight different types of units: Infantry, Sniper, Machine Gun, Tank, Artillery, Headquarters, Flame Thrower, and Trench Raiders. Each player designs an army of sixteen units.

The object of the game is to destroy the enemy headquarters.

name: WWII Combined Arms
description:
"Board game for 2 players. World War II theme. No dice or cards. Each unit represents a brigade or battalion."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units.

There are thirteen types of units: General Infantry, Paratroopers, Engineers, Mechanized Infantry, Light Tanks, Medium Tanks, Heavy Tanks, Howitzers, Anti-Tank Guns, Anti-Aircraft Guns, Airfield, Fortifications, and Headquarters. Each player designs an army of sixteen units.

The object of the game is to destroy the enemy headquarters.

name: Thirty Years Warfare
description:
"Card Game for 2-4+ players. The Thirty Years War took place in Germany from 1618-1648. The main adversaries were the Catholics and the Protestants. Each player takes the role of a Military Contractor of the age. The goal is to use your skill as a general and an entrepreneur to amass wealth and fame."

Each player creates a Leader character with three random traits (skills). Each Leader has a Reputation score, which starts at 0 and is increased or decreased based on the Leader's performance in campaigns.

A Leader gains gold each turn based on the value of his employment contract. An additional random amount of gold is gained each turn for "savings, investments, contributions, estate incomes, financial backers, looting, etc."

"Victory: When the deck runs out, the player with the most Gold wins. If two players are tied, the player with the highest Reputation score wins."
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Pike and Shot, Print & Play

name: WWI Many Fronts
description:
"Two Player Card & Bidding game. Simulation of World War I (The Great War)"

The game last 18 turns, spanning the time period of 1914-1918.

"One Player is the Entente Powers (EP): Britain, France, Russia, Serbia, Italy, Romania, Greece, USA. The other Player is the Central Powers (CP): Austria-Hungary, Germany, Bulgaria, Turkey."

The game is played across six fronts: Western, Eastern, Balkan, Italian, Turkish, and the "War at Sea." There are three Territory Markers at each Front. A Front is captured by winning all three Territory Markers at the Front.

"Victory: The first player to capture the Western Front wins the War. If the EP captures the Eastern Front he wins the War. After 18 turns the player who has captured the most Fronts wins, otherwise it is a Stalemate."

name: Tunnel Rat
description:
"Vietnam War tunnel combat. Bluffing game for 2 players. One Player is the US Tunnel Rat. The other player is the VC."

By asking questions, the US player must determine if the VC's current card is a tunnel, Viet Cong unit, or trap. The US player must acquire five tunnel cards before the VC player can inflict five casualties.

name: Katuvu
description: Observation game to play while traveling. Players are dealt a hand of cards. As soon as they see something that corresponds to one of their cards, they announce and remove it. Get rid of your cards to win.

name: The Triangle Challenge
description:
The Triangle Challenge - A Game of Strategy & Daring

The object for each player is to score the most points by creating triangles where all three end-points match the color of their wooden stacker. The larger the triangle, the larger the point value. The player with the most points after all 20 discs have been played, wins!

The Strategy - Strategy is the key to secretly loading your wooden stacker and selecting which move to make on every turn. Each player controls 5 red and 5 blue discs.

The Dare - Daring is essential to out-fox your opponent on every turn. Try to bluff and trick your opponent into helping you create more triangles of your color to win, without letting yourself be fooled.

Contents: Wooden game board, two wooden stackers, twenty discs (10 blue, 10 red), instructions.

name: Pocket Rocket Racers
description:
The first in a series of games that can be carried in your wallet! This is a wild rocket race across your tabletop!

This game is best played on any tabletop littered with objects. These objects become the obstacles on the race course. The players should begin by defining the start line, the course through the obstacles and the finish line. The the racers should be placed power-side up at the start line.

Get the full game here:
http://gnomegaming.com/ourgames

name: Don't Touch My Booty
description:
A silly little pirate game for 2 players!
Goal: Arrrgghh! To be the pirate with the most booty at the end of the game, of course! This is done by creating rows of 3 or more coins.

Full Game Here:
http://gnomegaming.com/ourgames

name: Face to Face Paddington
description:
Contents: 36 hexagonal tiles, each with 6 triangles showing pictures of Paddington in different colours.

Before you start, choose one of the figures shown on the side of the box. This should be used as model. All cards are divided amongst the players. The youngest player starts by laying one card face-up on the table. The player on his left-hand side then takes one of his cards and puts this next to the "open" card, in such a way that the previously chosen figure can be made. The cards have to be laid out face to face. When a player is unable to lay a card on the table, he has to skip a turn. The first player to lose all his cards is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Puzzle

name: Pisa Gratto
description: Similar to other Mechanism: Tower Stacking, players start with a tilted tower made of 1/2 cylinder pieces. Players take turns removing one of the pieces from the tower and placing the piece on the top. The player who is the last to stack a piece without causing the tower to topple is the winner.
publishers: Jumbo, New Entertainment Ltd, SYU Creation

name: Into the Valley of Death
description:
"Simulation of the Charge of the Light Brigade, the final phase of battle of Balaclava in 1854."

"The player controls a British cavalry group of 12 men known as a ‘Troop’. All men are mounted on horses. All men are armed with a sword. One of the men is the Captain, the leader of the troop. Another man is the Trumpeter. The other 10 men are referred to as riders. There are 3 types of Troops: Dragoons, Hussars, and Lancers." The player chooses which type of Troop to use.

The object of the game is to charge the Russian gun battery and return, scoring as many points as possible. Points are earned for each surviving man in the Troop and for overcoming challenges.

Played using the WarpQuest game system.

name: drakkar
description:
Contents: a square board 13×13, 30 tokens with an emblem printed on a face (6 different emblems), 8 pawns, 2 dices.
Each player is given 5 emblems, and his goal is to capture 5 tokens of this emblems. He can play his pawns or his tokens accordingly to the dices. Each time a player plays a pawn upon a token, he chooses between two actions:
- to look secretly the emblem, then to put it back at his place, or
- to take the emblem by flipping it. If it reveals to be one of those the player is looking for, he keeps it, else he must stay in jail for two moves.

name: The Letter Carrier Game
description:
"People play letter carriers and maneuver through situations that aid and hinder them in making all deliveries safely and efficiently."

The object of the game is to optimize the delivery path and be the first to finish.

The board is made up of sixteen two-sided square tiles, featuring neighborhoods named after U.S. municipalities. The game comes with 292 more pieces, including dice, hand-painted pawns, and "chance" cards, which feature obstacles (such as an angry dog), incidents (falling ice), transportation (bicycle), and helps (helmet).

Players can accumulate cards to help or sabotage an opponent.

The designer worked with his father, a retired letter carrier, to make the game as true-to-life as possible.

Home Page: http://lettercarriergame.com/
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Levantine Crusades
description:
“Card game for 2 Players. Simulation of the Crusades during the 11th to 13th Centuries. One player is the Christian Crusaders. The other player is the Muslims.”

“The game is played in 18 hands. Every 2 Hands represent a Crusade and then the Muslim Reaction.”

At the end of The Ninth Crusade, the player with the most Territory Tokens wins. Territory Tokens represent how much of the Holy Land a player controls. Having one token represents control of Syria, having two represents control of Jerusalem, and having three indicates extensive control of the Holy Land.
