The objective of the game is to quickly try to find words in a certain given category. For every word you name, you flip the first letter of that word from the game board, thus preventing others from using words with that letter. The person who's able to flip the most letters in 90 seconds, wins.

The game comes with an electronic timer and a handy way to mark used letters.

name: Fotbolls-MIG
description:
A Swedish quiz game containing 380 questions about football (soccer). The questions come in 5 categories: 'Swedish football', 'International football', 'The stars', 'The World cup' and 'All sorts'.

A die is rolled to to decide category. The first time you give a correct answer in a category this is marked in the score sheet.
The winner is the player who first has given correct answers in all categories.

name: Battle of the Tanks
description:
User Summary:

This is an extremely rare Milton Bradley game from WWII. The International Game Database lists its publish date as 1942.

The object of the game is to gain the most points over 5 games played.

First Player is chosen by roll of the dice. Each player in turn rolls two dice and moves 2 tanks. One tanks move the number of spaces indicated by one die and the other tank moves the number of spaces indicated by the second die. If you only have 1 tank left then you can move the number of spaces indicated on either of the die or the total of both.

You may move in any direction except diagonally. You cannot move forward and then backward in the same move but you can move over the same square repeated as your move.

If you land on an enemy tank with an exact move you capture the tank. Each captured tank is worth 5 points and winning a game is also worth 5 points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cuadrados Magicos
description:
From the publisher:
Try this fast puzzle solving game for two players. Take all the pieces and be ready for the pattern you will need to build. Built it fast and correct and you will win.

The contents:
32 pattern tiles
Rule book
Patter book

The players divide all the tiles into two piles. Each player then tries to build a pattern that they choose from the patter book. Each pattern is made up of 16 tiles, so every pattern can be built. Be the first player to win 5 rounds and you win the game.

name: Icebomb Arena
description:
Icebomb Arena is a strategy game of gladiatorial combat in a bomb-laden arena for 4 or more players. Each player is a gladiator in the arena. Icebomb Arena is played with Icehouse pyramids on a chessboard.

Each turn consists of a planning phase and an action phase. During the planning phase, players will determine the orientation of pyramids which will determine the actions they can take during the action phase. During the action phase, each player will take two actions either blocking or moving on the board.

The goal is to be the last player with a gladiator on the board that has health. The players can lose health through fights with other gladiators and through stepping on squares that have bombs.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Icehouse Plant Game
description: The Icehouse Plant Game is an Icehouse Pyramid game played inside a loop of string. Each player controls a plant that is trying to grow while blocking all of the light energy from the other players' plants. The more energy your plant can collect, the bigger it can grow, but you must be careful not to grow so fast that you kill your leaves.

name: Whoopee!
description:
A card and dice game for 2-4 players where players roll the dice trying to match the numbered cards in front of them. The ten cards are numbered 2 through 6, and 8 through 12 (no number 7). The players also receive 25 counters in a single color.
The game is played by rolling the dice and matching the number rolled to the cards in front of them. If a number that was previously rolled is rolled again, the next player shouts "Whoopee!" and play passes to the next player to the left who still has that number face up. If no one has that number still face up, the current player keeps rolling. If a 7 is rolled, the player has to place a counter in the center of the table and play passes to the player on the left. Play continues until one player has turned over all their cards. That player gets all the counters in the table's center plus one counter from each player per card remaining face up. That player then begins the next round.
(from the enclosed "Directions for Playing Whoopee!")

name: Dictum: The Latin Rummy Card Game
description: From the rulebook: "Each card has printed on it one Latin word. The aim of the game is to make phrases out of these words, from the list given, to make a 'full house'."

name: Stalin's Fury
description:
From the publisher:
STALINGRAD, SOVIET UNION, 22 October 1942: The German 6th Army push into the heart of Stalingrad played directly into the hands of the defenders, intent on contesting every building. Pavlov’s House became the name of one particularly well-defended apartment building, its moniker gained from Sergeant Yakov Pavlov, who commanded the platoon which first seized the building and which kept defending it throughout the battle. The house was a four-story building in the city-center of Stalingrad, overlooking a large square, the 9th January Square . The small garrison established anti-tank and machine-gun posts at the windows and held off all attacks for fifty-nine days. Each time enemy infantry or panzers attempted to reach the defenders, Pavlov’s men took them under heavy fire littering the square with corpses and wreckage. Eventually the defenders, as well as the Russian civilians who remained in the basement throughout, held on until 25 November 1942, when they were relieved by counter-attacking Soviet forces.

This is STALIN'S FURY, a brand new set of four scenarios + a new 22" x 34" map on heavyweight stock. You also receive a color (red, naturally) cover and VARIANT RULES page. All you'll need to dive into the heart of the inferno that was the Battle of Stalingrad during 1942.

This scenario pack also includes Teufelhunden (GWASL #1) a 1918 WW1 scenario set in Belleau Wood France.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points

name: Rolls Race
description:
Rolls Race - The exciting new game of chance.

Rolls Race is a board/dice/card game Which is played in two parts. In part I, dice rolls determine which numbers will be eliminated from the "race". It is these eliminated numbers which determine the "point values" which will be paid into the "pot". Part II consists of the actual "race" to the top of the board. Players holding cards matching the first number to reach "home", are the winners, and entitled to split the "pot".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Het Grote Flintstones Spel
description:
Dino, Pebbles, Bamm Bamm and Mr Slate have lost their stuff in Bedrock.
Players have to roll and move their character's to get the stuff back. Each character has lost four items. But the character's can only carry 2 items. Players have to put the items in the sheds of the other players.
The first player with an empty shed and arrives in Bedrock, wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aufbruch zu den Sternen
description:
It´s the year 2888, players are in control of megacorporations who rule the earth. They all have the goal to colonize the galaxy and for this purpose they are building huge space ships, hiring the colonists ( with soldiers, scientists, farmers and more amongst them ) buying equipment for their ships and finally take of to fight for the stars.

Each player has 3 Spaceships throughout the game wich have to be launched one after another.
Players are bidding for equipment, fuel and colonists and when they are satisfied with the outfitting of their ships they will launch them to colonize the different planets wich are laid out at the beginning of the game by players choice.
The equipment will prevent damage to your spaceships, give them more speed or even weapons to kill Aliens or enemy colonists.
Most planets have some sort of requirement in order to be colonized.
If there are Aliens present you can kill them with soldiers or send a diplomat and share the planet with them.
You can discover rare ore and receive equipment for the next ship for free and many more.
But you always have to send enough farmers to feed your colonists, unless you have the hydroponic farm equipment of course.
Spaceships are moved by different dice ( D4, D6, D8 ) but whenever you throw a 1 your spaceship gets damaged and loses either equipment or colonists.
Players earn the most points for the majority on a planet but they also earn ( less ) points for having a minority.
After every player has unloaded his last spaceship the game ends and the winner is the player with the most points.

For every player there will be 5 randomly drawn planets ( out of 22 ) on the map, so no game will ever be the same.
There are 10 different equipments and 7 different types of colonists to choose from.
The planets can be empty, have Alien inhabitants, accidic atmosphere, rare ore or they can be fertile.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: The Tiltyard
description:
From the Designer's own description:

"The Tiltyard is a sort of multi-round trick taking game, somewhat like a cross between the Sedma Group and a beating game. The game is themed around jousting events (the lance, the axe, and the sword) so there are three rounds with two "passes" each. One player leads a card and the other must play a higher card of the same colour, or a matching card of the opposite colour, or pass. If they play a card, then the trick continues and the other player faces the same three options. This continues until someone passes, the other player captures all of the cards played to the trick. At the start of the game, each player chooses 3 Royal Favours (court cards or Aces). These cards can be activated at the beginning of a round to impart a special ability to the owner (for instance, a Jack adds +1 to the value of all cards of its colour). They also determine which cards will be used for scoring your captured tricks: only cards of the majority colour within the 3 Royal Favours are counted."

All you need to play are the rules (PDF file) and a standard deck of cards.

name: Run Mousey Run
description:
Description from box:

The little mouse who's hungry for cheese
Must avoid the cat and the old lady's broom
Help him to escape through the mousehole with ease,
Or win all the cheese that's there in the room.

User Summary:
The mouse is pulled back and wound up, then released from the center circle. Where will he land? Will you win 1-4 pieces of cheese (get 8 on your cheese board and you win!) or will you get the broom or the cat? If the mouse gets out through the mouse hole past the cat you win automatically.

name: Raftaway
description:
"During a storm your ship was blown off course and you were shipwrecked on a deserted island. There are 3 other islands across the sea, but beyond that you can see nothing but ocean.

As you start to gather materials to make a campfire, you realize that you will need to build a raft to sail away to freedom.

Even when you have gathered enough materials to build a raft, you will need to prepare for what the island has in store for you; there are snakes, sharks, cyclones, tsunamis and much more to contend with! This paradise island is anything but paradise"

Raftaway is game for 2 to 4 players and takes between 30 to 60 minutes to play.

Each player has been stranded on one of 4 different islands, which neighbour each other.

The objective of the game is to build a Raft and have enough Health and Energy to sail away from the Island.

This is a Print and Play game. All you will need to supply is 8 plastic markers (2 per player).
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Starship Sneak
description:
User Summary: An entry for the "Sneaky Sci Fi Game Design Contest"

Your starship has been captured, your crew are being systematically executed and soon you will join them. From your cell you can hear the fusion reactors running - the enemy has taken your ship into warp. No doubt they have set course for your homeworld, using the coordinates in the ship's database.

On your way to be executed, you manage to overwhelm and kill the guards. Is your only chance to save your homeworld destroying this ship before it arrives?

The aim of this game is to sneak around your subjugated starship, while avoiding the guards, to collect item cards which will allow you to either retake your starship or destroy it to prevent it remaining in enemy hands.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Titanic
description:
The object of the game is to save the passengers from the sinking ship.

Each player receives the captain, crew, gool cubes, and chopsticks. The boat, rescue boat, and the rescue chips are placed on the table. The other components are the iceberg, passengers, and the dice.

The turn player choose one of followings.

1. Move the passenger to the rescue boat
The player rolls two dice. One is the number of passengers, another is the kind of passengers. They are placed on the rescue boat by one hand. When the passenger is droped form the rescue boat, the turn is end and lose the crew from his or her hand.

2. Go to the rescue boat
The player use the chopsticks and move the rescue boat to one of the gool cubes. Then the player get the points. When the boat touches the iceberg or the passenger is dropped, the turn ends, and the player loses the crew.
The captain is included in the crew. When he is lost, the player lose the game.

The winner is the player who has the most points.

name: Mystic Cauldron
description:
The kingdom is in dire need of potions and a great reward is awaiting the potions master who can bottle the most. Each player has recipes for various potions. Players take turns adding any color ingredient into the cauldron and as they do, potions will be completed. Win by bottling the most of each potion!

By using a simple tic-tac-toe mechanic, players attempt to form patterns which provides a unique and challenging game with each new play.

Mystic Cauldron is no longer available via The Game Crafter. It is available for free on Tabletop Simulator on Steam: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=22105...
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: The Universal Space Combat System
description:
From the publisher:

The Universal Space Combat System is a simple, fast-paced science fiction miniatures-based futuristic space combat system that can be used with genres heavily based on science or heavily based on fiction, and throughout a wide variety of technology levels. It can stand alone as its own skirmish or massive fleet game, or be integrated into just about any existing science fiction Role-Playing-Game.

This game splits up portions of the rules into both a SCIENCE fiction (SCIfi) setting, or a science FICTION (sciFI) setting Essentially, space fights that look cool, or space fights that are based more on realism, with the ability for players to mix and match aspects of each as they see fit. It allows for space combat in worlds where ships tow each other by grappling hooks or by tractor beams, where space marines board by teleporting onto the other ship or by laser-cutting open holes in the hull, and where faster-than-light travel happens by a single instantaneous jump, or by traveling days in a warp bubble that allows ships to chase and fight each other while racing at speeds beyond comprehension.

name: Wide World of Sports Quiz
description:
The object of the game is to move around the board answering sporting questions, when you get the trivia correct then you get a chance to move your playing piece along the running track. The first person to cross the line first wins.

There are certain events in the game which makes you move back on track track as well.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Land of Industry
description: A board game of industrial growth in the 19th to early 20th century. Players manage their income level and money to gain cards to build canals and railways and construct industrial buildings at city sites. Additional points are gained for connecting routes to export sites and for bidding to be Mayor of a city when it is completed. Anything can be traded between players. A map with 15 cities and 8 different kinds of terrain is provided as well as over 150 development and action cards. (User Summary)
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Alien Struggle
description:
Publisher blurb

The Alien Struggle game system

Space-- the Final Frontier. This is the game where you send out starships to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life forms and new civilizations, and kick their ass…

Alien Struggle is a one to four player game played on a tabletop where players are leaders of alien races that have recently discovered faster-than-light drive. Expanding outward, exploring their way into the galaxy they colonize new worlds, make contact with less developed alien races and discover ancient artifacts. Each race has its own unique equipment and special rules. Players may engage in combat or in peaceful trade and co-existence. Each game is a new experience since players create the game "board" anew every game by drawing world tiles from the Cosmic Cup. Players explore, discover new worlds, establish colonies and recruit new units to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, developing secret weapons and fighting desperate battles.

Each game set can be played by itself or combined with any of the other Alien Struggle game sets to increase the size of the galaxy and add new races, allowing larger games with up to 20 players. Each race comes with its own special rules, unique abilities and pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

Alien Struggle Game sets include a four-page rulebook, die-cut cardstock science chits, two player aid sheets, plus unique rules and die-cut pieces for FOUR different alien races depending on the set
. Each set is compatible with any of the others or can be played separately.

There are five sets -each ordered separately: The Coming of the Cosmic Prophet, Cyborg Invasion, Hiver Hegemony, Federation & Empire, and the Shadow War. Alien Struggle isn't a particular game, it's the mother system. You get one or more of the sets to play. Any set can be played on its own or combined with any of the others to make a bigger game.
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Scram
description:
In this abstract racing game, each player has 5 pawns that each can move a different number of squares per move indicated by it's number (the "2" pawn may only move 2 squares).
The winner is the first to get all their pawns to the finish. Players can capture eachothers pawns by landing on the same tile. These are then sent back to their initial starting positions.

Part of the Clipper Duel Serie
Possibly only published in Dutch/French.

name: Alphabet Match Me
description:
Build alphabet skills with game-like practice and play. Game boards and activity ideas easily adapt to growing skills for lasting matching and memory practice from age 3 to age 6.

Photos of familiar objects make real-world connections and keep kids interested. Match alphabet letter pairs to objects with the same beginning sound. Photo clues of each object let younger learners use visuals to match the letters, and on the back kids use the beginning letter sound to match each letter pair.

(source: publisher's website)

Play 3 Ways!

1. Lotto - Find the matching cards for the squares on your game board!
2. Memory Challenge - Lay cards face down, flip, and find matches!
3. Matching - Every card has a match. Find them all!


Two-sided game boards offer two skill levels of play.
Game pieces feature safe, rounded corners.
Game pieces are extra thick and rigid, perfect for preschool play!
All game pieces are coated for durability and easy clean-up.
Recognizable, realistic color photographs.
8 game boards, 52 cards.


(source: the back of the game box)

name: Rock - Paper - Scissors
description:
Rock – Paper – Scissors is an abstract 2 or 3 player combat game, based on the children’s hand game where rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper, and paper beats rock. Players place, move or flip over tiles with Rock, Paper or Scissor symbols. They try to capture opponent’s tiles by surrounding them with enough tiles showing the symbol that beats the symbol showing on the surrounded tile. The object of the game is to be the first player to capture enough of their opponent’s tiles to make two sets of 3 captured tiles.

Contents
15 Tiles in each of three colours
play mat

Rock – Paper – Scissors tiles are hexagonal, with a rock or paper or scissors symbol on each face. The symbols on the two sides of a tile are always different, and there are 3 different types of tiles with different combinations of symbols on them: Rock/Paper, Paper/Scissors and Scissors/Rock. The 15 tiles for each player consist of 5 tiles of each of the 3 different types. In addition to the large symbol on each face of the tile, there is a small symbol which shows what the symbol on the other side of the tile is, which enables players to make decisions about flipping tiles without having to disturb the tiles.

name: European War
description:
Introducing the Game

The successor to the Austrian throne survived Sarajevo assassination and became in 1916 the Emperor Franz Ferdinand. Just a few years passed and in Europe it simmer again!

At the outbreak of the war, Europe is divided into five blocks, which are: Britain and its Allies, the Russian Empire, France and its Allies, Ottoman Empire and Central Powers.

The game uses a modified original map of Europe, close to the state in 1914, but reflecting the development of an imaginary continent.

Key imaginary historical events before the war include the following:

Britain: In the twenties Britain got into serious conflicts with the Tsarist Russia and left the Triple Entente. From the thirties there was a gradual democratization in the colonies. Scandinavian countries see in the UK its natural protector against expanding Russia and Germany. After the riots in the Iberian Peninsula, Gibraltar outpost spreads to Andalusia and Portugal.

The Russian Empire: in the late twenties hit the Russian Empire its limits in far Asia. The Grand Duchy of Finland used the growing tension between Russia and Britain to escape from the Russia in early thirties. The abdication of a liberal the Tsar and the emergence new militant faction to power jump-started a new phase of armaments in Europe.

France: After the failed assassination in Sarajevo, it was France who saved by its diplomatic activity the European peace. In the thirties, France tried to create a large Mediterranean Union. South of the Apennine peninsula and Balkan were hit by neoislamic expansion of the Ottoman Empire and the French plan foiled. Against the traditional enemy - Germany - has France built an extensive Maginot Line.

Central Powers: Emperor Franz Ferdinand poured into crusty Austro-Hungarian veins new blood. In early twenties he federalized and modernized Austro-Hungary and in the thirties gradually agreed to trade and customs union with imperial Germany. The economic and military power of Central Powers long dampen expansionary ambitions of neighboring states. The Germans built along the lines with France its own line of defense - Siegfried Line.

The Ottoman Empire: the rapid modernization of the Ottoman Empire, launched by the world's thirst for oil, awoke southeast Europe to a new prosperity. Once Europe's sick man rallied by endless supply of black gold. In the late twenties, after a series of smaller conflicts, Ottomans returned to the southern Balkans and Islamic radicalization in the thirties dominate in large areas of northern Africa and even in southern Italy.

Each of the Powers thinks only of itself and just like you wants to be the best and win over all. Powers also conclude mutually beneficial agreements, lead diplomatic negotiations to form a military alliances, and so even you can not ignore this part of the game. Occupy all three fields of one power or help push your arch-enemy of its territory. This is not "Ludo", this is "The War."

Goal of the game

Your task is to occupy the entire territory of any other power (three fields of one color), while keeping on your own territory at least one pyramid.

You also win when your arch enemy loses his last piece from his own territory. His loss is your victory.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Open Drafting

name: Casey-Opoly
description:
CASEY-OPOLY was produced to celebrate the 35th Anniversary of Casey’s General Stores.

Patrons of this popular convenience store chain were treated to a virtual Casey’s shopping trip, with a light-hearted look at store items and the Casey’s shopping experience. The game retailed throughout all of the Company’s locations. Manufacturer coupons were included in the game to promote the items found in the store. Collectively, the coupons provided greater value than the cost of the game. Casey’s General Store enjoyed 100% sell-through of the games.

Publisher's Description
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: El OCho
description:
In this dice game, you must know how to stop in time to mark points. In every throw, put aside one or several dice, then throw the remaining dice. If your throws contain one 1, one 5 or a three of a kind you mark points. As for 8 it saves you, but any mediocre throw cancels the accumulated points.
The first player in 8000 points wins the game

name: Gef√§hrlich Ehrlich
description:
Gefährlich Ehrlich (engl. Precariously honest) is a communication and party game.
The players move their pawns long a trail froms start to goal, answering questions. Their pace of movement is determinend by how well they have solved the last question. Die kind of question is determined by the field their pawn is standing on. There are three different categories:

Extreme! : All players vote which one of two contrary characteristics on a Extreme!card fits most to the character of the active player. The two characteristics are either both negative or both positive, so everybody is forced to give a honest vote for the more fitting characteristic.

Hey, that´s You!: All players point at each other simultaneously, voting who at the game table fits most to a given attribute.

Top or Flop: A situation is described on a card. The active player has to describe how he/she would solve it. The other players vote (by showing thumb up/down simultaneously) if they think his answer is honest and fits to his character.

As a very important aspect of the game, players act a lot with their hands while playing: swinging the fists, counting aloud, pointing fingers on other player, showing thumbs up/down and declaring counting-out rhymes together. So there is always action at the game table.

Gefährlich Ehrlich is not just a fun game but also a kind of tool to find out more about how other people look at you and what kind of character they think you are.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Kursk 1943: Turn of War
description:
The Battle of Kursk refers to German and Soviet operations on the Eastern Front during World War II in the vicinity of the city of Kursk, (450 kilometres / 280 miles south of Moscow) in the Soviet Union in July and August 1943. It remains both the largest series of armored clashes, including the Battle of Prokhorovka, and the costliest single day of aerial warfare. It was the final strategic offensive the Germans were able to mount in the east. The resulting decisive Soviet victory gave the Red Army the strategic initiative for the rest of the war.

Kursk 1943: Turn of War - card wargame on theme world war II for two player.

Kursk 1943: Turn of War includes Tigers, Panther, T-IV, Mark IVs, T-34, KV-1 as well as the infantry and anti-tank guns that fought alongside them.

Components


320 colorful playing cards
Rules and scenario booklet
Players' Aid card
Two dice
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Poleaxed Source Book Volume 1
description:
This book provides a summary of orders of battle and battle maps for the early Wars of the Roses battles from St. Albans (1455) through Towton (1461). While designed for the "Poleaxed" miniatures rules, conversions for WRG's popular DBA and DBM rules are provided. Biographies of notable commands are also provided.

Battles included are:

First St. Albans, 22 May 1455
Blore Heath, 23 September 1459
Northampton, 10 July 1460
Wakefield, 30 December 1460
Mortimer's Cross, 3 February 1461
Second St. Albans, 17 February 1461
Towton, 29 March 1461
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Poleaxed Source Book Volume 2
description:
This book provides orders of battle and battle maps for the later Wars of the Roses Battles, from Hedgeley Moor, 1464 to Stoke Field, 1487. While the rules are designed for the Poleaxed medieval rules, conversions for WRG popular DBA and DBM rules are provided. Commander biographies are also included. Battles included are:


Hedgeley Moor, 25 April 1464
Hexham, 14 May 1464
Edgecote, 26 July 1469
Losecote Field, 12 March 1470
Barnet, 14 April 1471
Tewkesbury, 4 May 1471
Bosworth, 22 August 1485
Stoke Field, 16 June 1487
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Stranamore
description:
Stranamore = Strangelove

It was a TV program where a person could send a love message to another person using TV.... usually because he did something wrong.


Within your many friends there is a special person whom you may lose because of your misbehaviour. Follow him (or her) all around Italy, choose the right words and write the most loving message so that he (or her) may forgive you and you may regain your place in his (or her) heart. You have to be the better one, otherwise the other players may beat you to him (or her).

Italian:
Tra tanti amici e tante amiche c'è una persona speciale che, per il tuo comportamento, rischi di perdere. Inseguila per l'Italia, scegli le parole giuste, scrivi il messaggio più accattivante per farti perdonare e prova a riprendere il tuo posto nel suo cuore. Ma devi essere il più brillante, perché altrimenti gli altri pretendenti potrebbero avere la meglio!

name: Global Resolution
description:
Gobal Simulation circa 1990-2010. Each player takes the role of 1 Nation: USA, Russia, EU, China, Japan, or India. Each
Nation has 4 Traits: Economy, Military, Social, and Environmental. Players play Development Cards to improve their traits. Each player draws 1 card from the Crisis deck each turn. There are 10+ types of Crises, most requiring a decision on the part of the player on how to resolve them. Some decisions are riskier than others. Through resolution of Crises, players earn Prestige Points which will ultimately determine the winner.

name: Turtler
description: This is an Icehouse board game in the style of the Frogger video game. Icehouse pieces represent cars on a road that might run over turtles that are trying to cross the road. Each player secretly programs a series of moves for their turtles, and then the moves are revealed and resolved. Hitting traffic will cause your turtle to backtrack. The first person to reach the other side of the street is the winner!

name: Defender of the Crown
description:
Cinemaware's Thematic Overview

"In a time of lusty wenches and black-hearted villains, King Richard has been murdered and England thrown into civil war! Amidst the ringing clash of steel and the thunder of charging steeds the bold Saxon knights have chosen you to lead them into battle against the hated Normans. Players will compete in grand tournaments of joust, siege castles and raid enemy strongholds in their attempt to find the lost crown of England. Enlisting the support of Robin Hood, players will have to outwit their enemies to control England and restore order to a war-torn land."

Game Description

Defender of the Crown is set in the Middle Ages, where following the death of King Richard, players assume the role of a Saxon lord, try to fight off Norman hordes and ultimately wrestle for complete control of England. The players will collect valuable resources to build strongholds, amass armies and fight for control of opponents' castles and territories.

Players may engage enemy lords with their armies on the battlefield or contest lands and fame in medieval tournaments. They may also loot the treasuries of opposing lords or lay siege to their castles. Players must also contend with random events such as plague, drought, locusts while fighting for their right to be crowned King of England.

Once a player has taken control of all enemy counties they will be crowned king and win the game.

name: Monopoly: Turkish edition
description: Monopoly is a board game published by Parker Brothers, a subsidiary of Hasbro. The game is named after the economic concept of monopoly, the domination of a market by a single entity.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: QuUMP
description:
Tag Line: The exciting bump and jump game

From the instructions:
The first objective in a QuUMP game is to "QuUMP", which means moving your playing pieces all from start to home in the fewest turns.

My understanding of the game:
QuUMP is a Parcheesi-like game in which a player must get his pieces from his start position to the center home spot. The game can be played by two to four players each using one of the colors: blue, green, red, or yellow. What is unique about this game are the playing pieces. Each piece is about 1/2 inch in height and pieces are of various shapes. If you look straight down on the pieces from above, the shapes are: square, triangle, circle, diamond, and octagon. Furthermore, the square pieces come in three sizes: small, medium, and large. In the basic game, only three of the shapes are used. Many advanced variations exist, including one in which all the shapes are used.

The game board has a series of tracks that lead from the start area to home. Each piece must follow the track that matches its shape. The square piece must follow the square track, the circular piece must follow the circular track and so on. The tracks connect to each of the player's start areas to the central home area and hence intersect with each other.

Certain points on the tracks and intersections allow players to jump their piece over other pieces or to bump opponents pieces back along their respective tracks.

Finally, players can roll up to five dice (just once) to gain additional movement points. Players must cover the numbers 1 to 6 with the five dice. Two or more dice can be used to cover one number. For example, on a roll of 1-2-2-3-6, the player could cover the numbers 1, 2, 5, and 6. In this example, 3 and 4 would be left uncovered, allowing the player to move pieces an additional seven spaces.

The first player to move all of his pieces to home is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Het Grote Bruid & Bruidegom Spel
description:
A marriage themed trivia game.

Each player gets a marriage certificate card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the marriage certificate card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the marriage certificate card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Het Grote Sudoku Spel
description:
Players try to complete a Sudoku puzzle.

The first player tries to solve the puzzle. After 2 minutes the player passes the puzzle to the next player. Now that player has the chance to solve the Sudoku.
After 8 minutes the game ends. The player which filled in the most answers correctly wins the game.

name: Jukebox Trivia
description:
Back of the box

Guess the names of pop songs, the bands or artists who sang them and what lyrics belong where. The all new Jukebox Trivia card game is available in three versions: Novice for those who don't have a clue who Michael Jackson is, Intermediate for those who know every Madonna song ever released and Expert for those who consider themselves musical Einsteins!

name: Luring Royalty
description:
Royalty are scattered about the provinces and you, as queen, bring them to your kingdom. Gather up resources to lure in the nobles before your rivals do the same. The kingdom with the most prestige will rule the provinces!

Luring Royalty is a card game, requiring 2 standard decks of playing cards, for two to four players. The four jokers and one suit per player are used (eg. in a 3 player game, one suit of cards is removed so that you have just three suits). The cards are split into a Resource deck (Aces and 2-10) and a Royalty deck (Jacks, Queens, Kings, Jokers). Each player selects a suit and starts the game with a queen of that suit.

Three royalty cards are always available and each royalty card will have up to 7 resource cards in its row. The rightmost resource card may be added to a player's hand for free and other resource cards and royalty cards may be picked up by paying 2 resources per card to the right of the card being purchased.

When the royalty draw pile is expired, the game ends and players compare total prestige points. Points are earned as follows: 1 Point per Resource card of your suit; 1 Point for the 1st Jack; 2 Points per Queen; 3 Points per King; 4 Points per Joker; 6 Points per 2nd, 3rd, ... Jack; +4 Points per Queen & King of same suit; +1 point per Two Jacks of the same suit

Luring Royalty was designed and created for the Design Contest Entries: Traditional Card Games for Two Players run by Sean Ross (I).

Version 2 Rules Update (2010): Changed King/Queen bonus from +3 to +4
Version 3 Rules Update (2012): Use 2 resource cards with the same number for a purchase value of 12
Version 4 Rules Update (2016): Added Two Jacks of same suit bonus of +1; Allow gaining rightmost resource card for free with resource cards purchase
Version 5 Rules Update (2017): Players start with Queens instead of Kings; Changed 2nd, 3rd, ... Jack scoring value from 5 to 6 points

name: Dino Dig Challenge: Dinosaur Bone Excavation Game
description:
Dino Dig Challenge from Uncle Milton is a Battleship style game.
From the blurb on the back of the box "You're on a dinosaur dig, and the stakes are high. If you find all your opponent's Velociraptor bones, you win the game. Easy? Think again! You'll need to avoid dangerous tar pits as you build your Velociraptor with the excavated bones! The first player to excavate and build a complete Velociraptor wins!"

Players take turns to try to discover dinosaur bones using the same A-J, 1-10 grid references as Battleship. Key differences are that the bones do not have target points which consist of a single straight line and that the bones have preset positions to fit onto four 5x5 terrain tiles. Don't be fooled though, this preset position rather than destroying the game, as I expected actually makes it far more of a logical deduction game than a guess fest.

BTW the blurb about dangerous tar pits is just blurb. The game rules do not mention any tar pit effect.
mechanics: Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Las Grandes Batallas del Mediterraneo
description:
Las Grandes Batallas del Mediterraneo (The Great Battles of the Mediterranean) is a very early spanish wargame, covering six different war scenarios, settled around or near the Mediterranean Sea.

In each scenario there is two sides, and both beguin with the same forces, 12 ground forces and 6 naval forces, each force is compossed of six small units, and are represented by a "column" of pieces, and the units can be detached. Also each side have 3 fortified bases. Each player can move all his units each turn and can freely engange the enemy. One very special feature is that each side have a fixed number of artillery shots to use along the game.

The initial deployment is done blinded using a screen to shield the setup and the initial secret moves. The number of secret movements is agreed between both players before the game setup.

The game use a special six sides die, with no 1 or 6 and two 3 and 4. An have no limit turns, but an accordded time limit.

The winner of the game is the first owning 5 fortified bases or the one that eliminates half of the enemy units or at the end of the agreed time the winner is the side that had killed more enemy units (only if the difference is more than 5% of the initial force).

The six scenarios are: The Punic Wars, The Barbarian Invasions, The Arab Invasions, The Crusades, The Ottoman against Europe and Spanish - French Wars.

This is the second Spanish wargame ever published, only after La Reconquista, of this same editor.

name: Quiz Box Dinosauri
description:
Who was the Anatosaur? How fast was a Tirannosaur?

Quiz Box Dinosauri features 50 coloured cards with 100 questions and 100 answers on the Preistoric age's giants. Answer the questions on the cards' front and check in the back if you answered correctly! and learn Dinosaurs' life in a fun way. The player who answered the most cards correctly wins.

The cards are big - 95x135 mm
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Prehistoric

name: Spit It Out!
description:
Unrelated to the two other games of the same name, in this game players use a limited set of coloured lettered dice to spell out clues to get their team mates to guess a word. However a special "randomising canister" ensures players are only given a small set of letters at a time, so they will have to be creative in how they use those letters. Re-orienting the letters to make them look like others is very common.

Players roll a dice to move along a cloth "board" which can be packed up and stored, with the dice and letters, inside the cylindrical canister.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mission Patrol 2
description:
MISSION PATROL 2 PRINT & PLAY UNDERWATER GAME.
Mission Patrol 2 is a game that is played with card tiles that you withdraw and roll dice to determine your fate. Your mission to find and locate your targets and set the detonators in the reefs of Kimono and destroy the flesh eating infested sea creatures. The timer's ticking so hurry and reach for the safety boat and escape to win the game. This game is designed to be played by 1 or 2 players.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play

name: Ottocento
description:
Ottocento is a Tarot game for 4 players which comes from Bologna. Tarot games have been played in that city for over 500 years, and the game of Ottocento as currently played preserves distinct characteristics (both of the games and of the pack of cards) which go back at least to the 16th century. The special 62-card pack that is used and the game itself are often known as Tarocchino (pronounced tarokino), the diminutive form of Tarocco referring to the reduction of the pack from 78 to 62 cards.

Ottocento is a point-trick game, with trumps. The cards have point values individually (as in other Tarot games) but also score in combinations. There is no bidding, but players can score by declaring card combinations held in their hands at the start of play, as well as for combinations taken in tricks.

name: Stack Back
description: Place the different colored stacks (three colors) on different levels onto each other without making fall the building. Each stack has to be stacked onto two stacks of another color. The player who stacked one piece on another legally, can replay directly. The winner of the is the first player who has placed all of his 30 stacks.

name: Fool's Poker
description:
Fool's Poker is a surprisingly deep poker variant which retains the hidden information and bluffing of poker but adds a strong deductive element. It is played with a traditional 52-card deck.

At the beginning of the game, all players are have hands of size 5. Each round, the players are dealt a new hand. One player calls out a 5-card poker hand that they believe can be made by the collective cards of all the players. The player to their left must call the previous player's bluff by saying "BS" or similar, or otherwise state a higher hand of their own. Play continues clockwise until a player's bluff has been called. Players pool their cards and see if the last name hand can be assembled from their cards. If the hand is possible, the hand size of the player who called the bluff drops by 1. Otherwise, the hand of the player whose bluff was called decreases by 1.

The next round begins with fresh hands using the new lower hand limits. The player who called "BS" last round starts the new round. If a player's hand size drops to zero, they are out of the game. Play continues until the players only have 4 cards between them, and the player with most cards remaining is the winner.

Rules for hands:
Pair, Two Pair, 3 of a Kind, Full House, and 4 of a Kind: must name their card values
Straights, Flush, and Straight Flush: must name their high card
Flush and Straight Flush: also must name their suit

Variant: The 2's are wild able to take any value and suit. The 5 of a Kind hand becomes a valid poker hand, ranked higher than Royal Flush. This variant addresses the issue where, late in the game, it may be difficult to assemble even small hands.

name: Original Seestern-Party
description:
Seesternparty is an action card game. On a row of cards showing several fishes in different colours, players have to find pairs of fishes of the same colour, swimming in the same direction.
Those fish cards are replaced one after another.
If there is a pair, the player detecting it first, scores a point.

name: Igels: LARP-Spieler
description:
A promo card for the game. This one and Harz IV were used as giveaways to bridge the gap between release dates of the base set and the expansion set for Igels.

It is an extra weapon card that adds 4 to SAP (small animal power) in a battle.

name: Schlumpf Karussell
description:
From the publisher:
The new colorful Smurf Carousel of Ravensburger games on the Smurf village is great! The Smurfs can not get enough of the fast gyros, so that you will get dizzy ... With skill you manage to stop the carousel and with a good memory and a little luck, help the Smurfs find their homes.
Contents: 1 roundabout carousel,
24 Schlumpf cards,
1 Instructions
Suitable for children aged from 4 years
For 2-4 players

Gameplay

Youngest player begins. Player takes spinner-karussell and makes it spin as fast as he/she can. Then he stops it with his finger. Finger now shows one smurf that you need to find. If finger is between two of them, you can spin again.
Then you can turn over one smurf house to se if that one fits or not. If it is, you keep that house, if not, you lose your turn and leave the house where it was.
When you turn over smurf girls house, you can keep it right away and spin spinner again. If you turn over a black witch card, you miss a turn and discard that card...

The rules come with some variants and some tips for beginners and for pros on how to stop the spinner.

You win by getting the most cards.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: √â Hora de Votar!
description: In "É Hora de Votar!", players assume the role of voters and politicians. Each round, two players try to win the votes of the others, by promising to build parks, schools, hospitals etc. But everybody has a secret agenda, and to win an election a player must try to do what the majority of the voters want. The first player to complete all his secret and open goals wins the game (text created by the game's designer).

name: Dararara!
description:
The game is based on a Japanese light novel, Durarara!!
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durarara!!

One of the 500-yen games produced at Game Market 2010 in Tokyo, Japan. The deck consists of 15 each of three different color cards without numbers. These three colors represent three factions. You play and draw almost all the cards in front of you. The last three cards in your hand determine which faction you belong to: Blue, Red, Yellow or Daraas. You only score points if the faction you belong to is the one that most number of players belong to. In that case, you score the number of non-faction colors in front of you (For Daraas, the scores are fixed points). Clever little game.

name: Strike or Submit
description: "The devastating knockout. The expertly-executed submission. The blood, the drama, the upsets. All are present in Alex Williams Strike or Submit (S!O!S!): A Game of Mixed Martial Arts Combat. In S!O!S!, players use chart-and-dice (in a non-computerized format) to take control of their favorite mixed martial arts (MMA) fighters and pit them against one another in full-contact fights. Want to have Fedor fight Arlovski; Rickson battle Sakuraba; play out the latest Grand Prix tournament? All of this is possible in the most accurate and fun MMA game to date!" - From strikeorsubmit.tripod.com

name: L√≥gica
description:
It´s a provocative challenge: find out 4 pieces varying from 3 shapes and 3 colors.

One of the players put four shapes behind a panel. The others must find out wich is the correct sequence by looking at tip tiles. At the beginning of each round, a tip tile is turned face up and the main player must put some shapes at the correct locations. Based on these tiles, the players try to deduce the sequence.

name: Army Lists Volume 1: Armies of the Ancient Near East 3000BC - 500 BC
description: 71 armies for use with Wargames Rules 3000 BC to 1485 AD 7th edition. These lists cover the period from the first city states until the death of Philip II of Macedon
publishers: Hobby Products GmbH, Wargames Research Group

name: Army Lists Volume 2: Armies of the Far East, Asia, and America
description: 69 armies from the Far East, Asia, and America. For use with WRG 7th edition Ancient Rules 3000BC - 1485AD

name: Das Weinquiz
description:
Trivia card game about wine. The game consists of 55 cards with three questions. For each question, four answers are provided. At the start of the game, the players agree which question from each card is used (i.e. the first from each card - there are no categories). Players take turns reading out the questions. The first player to answer correctly gets the card. When all cards are used, the player with most cards is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Avalanche
description: It is a brazilian dexterity game. From the game box: "A equilibrium game for cool blooded persons" In this game you prepare a mountain of rings and balls, and on your turn, you must remove a selected ball from a ring, without leeting the mountain go down.

name: Small Wars
description:
User summary :

Small Wars is a fast contemporary miniature building (and destroying) skirmish game for 2 players, which has been designed to be played with bricks vehicles from the Coby line. Refence sheets of all the units are distributed with a free ruleset on the official website (http://www.smallwars-thegame.com).

While the way of winning may vary from game to game (area control, enemy destruction...), it is always played on a 3x3 grid area in a pre-set number of turns. Once battalions have been built with an army point system, players activate units and use action points to move and/or shoot enemy units at range, using a simple threshold dice system. At the end of the last turn, victory points are calculated regarding the scenario chosen, the player having the most of them being the winner.

name: Ki
description:
Ki is an territory game in the spirit of Go. In Ki there is no Ko and there is no Komi. A game of Ki cannot end in a draw.

Ki is played with standard Go equipment on any odd sized square board. 11x11 is a good size to start on.

The objective of Ki is to have more stones on the board when the board is full. Note that completely filling the board will not be necessary to determine the outcome of a game as many of the placements will become obvious towards the end.

Starting with black, players alternate placing stones. A player must have at least 2 stones orthogonally adjacent to a space in order to control it. A player controls a space when he owns a majority of the stones orthogonally adjacent to the space. If the space is occupied by his opponent, the enemy stone is removed from play. If a space is surrounded by an equal number of stones of both colors, it is a legal placement for either player. It is forbidden for a player to place a stone on a space controlled by his opponent, even to make a capture. If a player has no legal move on his turn he must pass. Passing is otherwise not permitted.

name: Jag fattar ingenting
description:
The game is an association game. You have 100 different cards with pictures on them. You draw one card and have a short time to think of different things that you can relate to that picture. After this you draw three new cards and then you should make links between the first picture and one of your choices. An link between to pictures can be something like this: Drill-something the dentist have-chair at the dentist something you lie in-lie you do in bed-pillow you have in bed-head on pillow-hat on head--the other picture.
As the trail of relations can be a bit vague, the other players have the choice to say that they don't agree with the thought-trail and if majority of players agree you lose this round, and the turn goes to the next player.
The first player with 5 wins, win the game.

A good party game with a lot of laughter’s. Goes quite well with children as they catch the rules quickly.

[The name in Swedish means I don't understand anything]

name: ABeeC Match Game
description:
From Game Instructions:
A BEE C Match Game is a fast-paced letter matching game for all ages. You don't have to know how to spell to play and you don't have to be a spelling bee champ to win. Simply match letter to letter and collect 7 cards to win.

Gameplay: On your turn, roll a handful of dice and match any dice you can to letters on the three playable cards. Put the last letter on a card and you win the card for a point and the dice for more to roll!

name: Ariel the little mermaid
description:
The board depicts a ship with seven hatches. Around it, there is a course of fields, some of which have special symbols. The hatches are covered with tiles. These hide characters from the Disney movie.
The players roll dice and move around the course. The goal is to collect a set of three cards depicting Ariel's friends, then go onto the ship and flip over hatch tiles. When a hatch tile shows one of the friends, another hatch tile can be flipped over. When the witch appears, the player has to start collecting cards again. When the prince appears, the game ends and the active player is the winner.
While circling the ship, special symbol fields enable the players to draw cards, move forward etc. When a player reaches a field where (an)other player(s) is/are, he/she can steal a card from each of them.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Áã¨ÁúºÁ´úÊîøÂÆó (Dokuganryu Masamune)
description:
Dokuganryu Masamune (Masamune, the single eyed Dragon) covers battles fought by Date Masamune nicknamed "Dokuganryu" (Single-eyed Dragon). He was a Champion of the North.
Three scenarios are included in this game: "Battle of Hitotoribashi" and "Battle of Suriagehara" (short games), "Tensho Crisis" (campaign game).

Each players controls one or more clans.
There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The actions that can be selected are movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

Victor of the game is the player who earns the most victory points. The victory points are provided by castle control and enemy units removal.

SCALE: Each hex of map is roughly 6000 meters. Each game turn represents one week of real time. Each combat units represents about 1000 soldiers.

name: Memphis Belle
description:
User Summary

This rules set, rather wordily subtitled A preposterously simple game (low on technology, high on empathy) about the American Daylight Bombing Campaign against Germany 1942-45 lives up to its billing.

The game requires only a few dice, a few playing cards, some player-created handouts, and a little imagination to play. Players go through simple pad and paper missions to see how hard it was for a bomber crew to survive a tour of duty.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #81 (June 1994)

name: Starship Marine
description:
Starship Marines is an Starcraft boarding game done by Jim Wallman for minimum two players, with no limit in players. The game itself is a print and play type, and available for free download.

From the Introduction in the basic rules:
Starship Marine is a set of science fiction wargame rules, designed for use with toy soldiers. The basic idea is that there is a battle to control and capture a starship by a boarding party moving down the corridors and rooms of the ship. One side controls the attackers, who are mostly composed of the eponymous 'Starship Marines', and the defenders, usually less well armed crewmen, with perhaps a smattering of Marines to stiffen the defense. The deck plans can either be drawn out or built in 3D, depending on your preferences and time available. The scale of toy soldier is 25mm or 1/72, and any make of figures can be used [...]

The minimum you need are a few toy soldiers, some dice, a large sheet of paper with a deck plan on it, and the rules. A typical small game takes about a hour or so (longer if you like arguing about rules). The largest game we know of, to date, involved some 60 people, hundreds of toy soldiers, and many very very big sheets of paper.[...]
categories: Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Maze, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Luca und die Farbenschafe
description: Luca and his white dog Baldur are to look after the tinted colour-sheep. The little shepherd leads the green sheep to a very green meadow, but what does that yellow sheep need? A book for reading out loud, to look at, to tell stories, a story on colours and tinted sheep, and a game in which to roll the die and thread the sheep onto a woollen string. Luca moves from spot to spot, if all the sheep and the dog are threaded before the sun sinks, all animals can sleep in the barn and the game is won.

name: Fast Play Armada Rules
description:
From the Introduction

"Last year I promised to present for discussion a set of rules covering the Armada period of naval warfare. Here are those rules, or rather a fast play version of the Channel Wargames Group's current set.

"The philosophy behind them is both to make an attempt to make a set of rules that give a good flavour of the period and the methods of fighting with ships current at that time. And to make the games played with them as enjoyable as is possible. Because of this things such as gunnery have been simplified as much as possible.

"Ships gunnery at the time of the Armada was a thing in a state of flux. It is as well to contemplate, that ships carried many different types of ordinance, all intermingled together on the same deck. The logistics of serving such a varied armament in a rapid manner was beyond the capabilities of the time, and I would hazard a guess beyond us today as well. Most authorities give a maximum rate of fire for the guns of the Spaniards as once, yes once, a day. Small pieces and hand held weapons were obviously much quicker to reload. Even the English rate of fire is said to have been at best once an hour. If this difference had been used in the rules the Spanish player's would be sitting on their for much of the game, and the English for quite long periods. The solution to this problem can be read in the rules themselves..."

User Summary

Rules set covers scale, speed of units, sailing rules, handling classes, wind effects, firing, ranges, firing charts, special effects table (effectively a sort of critical hit table), putting out fires, effects of bowing on hull factors, boarding, morale, special rules for galleys, a ship list, and a brief bibliography. Game requires models (1/600 preferred for ease of scratch building), and two types of dice (d6 & d20).

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

name: Archeoegypt
description: A gorgeous game in resin, coming in a huge wooden box. Two players or teams must dig for the Pharao's treasure, finding hints that will help them in the search. The valley of the Sphinx is made of little 3D spaces in resin that can be lifted to see what's under. A guide with the reproduction of real ancient Egyptian documents is featired to translate the hieroglyphics and identify Pharaos' names. The cost was impressive (150.000 liras - equivalent of 77.50 euros that was a really huge sum in mid '90s).

name: Vermilion: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Seven scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye Small Expansion
description:
Small expansion for the base game:

It comes with 4 new cars:
Ramone
Luigi
Guido
The King

Allows now the game to played up to 10 players.

And adds a new route as well called: "Even Longer". (Just adds 2 more tiles, with Luigi and The King special places.)
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Activity Superthema Freizeit und Essen
description:
Expansion to Activity with 220 new cards. Themes: leisure and food

The gameboard and pawns are needed from one of the basic Activity games.
Most of the new cards have book-, film- or play titels (theatre, opera, music), fairy tales or poems to be guessed by the teams
Also tasks about art and architecture, everything around food and kitchen and last but not least - games are includet in this theme pack.
It's a real challenge, to "dance" or picture the title of a poem, you might have learned in school - but will your teammates remember it too?

The minimum age is specified with 12, but 30 to 40 is best "experience-level"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Le Loto Des Saveurs
description:
A follow-up to Le Loto Des Odeurs, Le Loto Des Saveurs attempts to teach children about flavours.

The game contains 30 jars with tiny candies, and 30 cards with images of the different flavours. Each turn, one jar is opened and each player gets a candy. They now try to identify the flavour as quickly as possible. A player that wants to make a guess grabs the corresponding card, after which his guess is verified by the game master.

The game is won by the player who has guessed the most flavours correctly at the end of the game.

name: TAMGA
description:
TAMGA(Mark, Clan-Banner) board game description:
The players take the role of clan leaders of Anatolia and try to gain control of enemy clan leaders' capital cities to become the ultimate ruler of an empire. If a player loses his capital city, he is left out of the game. There are optional rules for winning: world domination, timed game play etc. The game map resembles RISK but the Tamga game map covers territories from eastern Europe, Anatolia and northern Africa. Battle mechanics involve dice rolling, army hiring and paying their upkeep cost, buying culture cards to be able to hire more powerful armies. Each clan has an army-location-figure to represent their army on the game map. A player can not have more than one army. The army of a player consists of maximum 3 squads. (Janissaries, Cavalry, Ranged attackers etc.) Specific cities have to be captured to hire specific squads. More powerful squads can be hired from more powerful neutral cities. A player has to defeat the militia of a neutral city to be able to hire those squads. The Tamga game comes with 6-sided(d6) special dice. Each die have three Star faces, two Crescent faces and one Sword face. Different squads have to roll different symbols to be successful. The cards representing the squads have special abilities against other squads written on them. More powerful armies require cultural achievements. The culture cards have historical flavor text on them and a culture point value at the bottom. A player has to pay money(AKCE) to buy culture cards and hire squads. The game comes with a small pouch filled with yellow and white metal coins called Akce. The coins are designed true to the original coins of era.

(from the official Tamga board game website):
TAMGA is a tactical strategic board game about the Ottoman Empire that takes place during from its the foundation until the end of its golden era. Players take role of Turkish leaders and try to defeat other players to become the ultimate ruler of Ottoman Empire.

The flavor texts on game cards, the money currency of the game called "akce" pieces, drawings of soldiers and Ottoman Empire game map are the result of hundreds of hours of research from historical literature.

The creation of game's historical texts and design took nearly four years of careful research and reading. During this time Associate Professor Erhan Afyoncu have been consulted numerous times to provide a true to the original historical experience for the players.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: I-Magi-Nation
description:
I-Magi-Nation is a dungeon crawler that got created during the "my many monster dice game competition" held by Todd Sanders in August 2010.
The task was, to create a game that uses mainly a couple of dice, that were permitted by Todd. Some of those dice are common, some are special dice, available from Flying Buffalo Inc
The required common dice are:
1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 1d12, 1d20
The special dice are:
1 complete set of monster dice
3 trap dice in different colors (e.g. blue, green, red)
1 corridor die
1 treasure die
Additionally to this, you will need some sheets of grid paper and a pencil to keep track of your stats and to draw the dungeon you are going to explore.

While the rules are written in English, the game itself depends on symbols and numbers only, so it can be easily transfered into any other language.

You start the game by creating your character and equipping him with a weapon and armor of your choice.
With your character you start on the first level of a dungeon and you have to reach the exit, which is 10 levels below.
Between the start and the end points, there are going to be hordes of monsters to defeat, but hoards of treasure to loot, too.
The dice will determine everything: What kind of dungeonsection you have found (a room, a corridor, ..), whether you have run into a trap and the kind of the trap, what monsters you will encounter (from a lowly rat up to a fierce dragon) and the kind of treasure you are going to loot (upgrades for your equipment, gold, jewelry or even scrolls with powerful spells on them).
Combat is fast, deadly and - driven by dice, of course.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Avanti!
description:
Roll and move with an ever-changing game board. The board consists of seven tiles which contain roads with intersections. One of these tiles is randomly chosen as the starting field; all players place their playing pieces on it.
The active player rolls and moves, trying to reach the field on a tile which shows his/her color. If successful, the player discards one of his/her handcards (the one with the number of the tile). When going over the edge of the board, another board tile with no player on it can be attached at that edge. When a player has gotten rid of all cards, s/he goes back to the starting tile. The first player to reach a certain field on that tile is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Community
description:
From the introduction:

COMMUNITY is a game which focuses people's action in a make-believe community while allowing them to utilize their own judgments and apply their own beliefs and values as if it were real.

It is a game which can be played by all age groups, but which is aimed primarily at youth, 10 years or older, or adults who have not been previously involved in community action and decision making. Each player is encouraged to vocalize his opinion - to investigate how each group decision will affect him. It is recommended for groups of not less than seven nor more than fifteen players.

There are no rules in COMMUNITY - only procedures by which to play. Dice Roll and Role Cards create a simulation of day-to-day living conditions and the responsibilities which we all must face. The Event Cards simulate events which affect the community and require a group decision. The Pollution Index forces the community to take group action and Community Improvements offer a way to improve the quality of life.

User Summary:
COMMUNITY is run by a Gamemaster who is in control of the game. Decisions about what a player can or cannot do are made by the Gamemaster based on his learning goals for the group. There are "rules" included with the game, but these can be adjusted per the Gamemaster's discretion. The game is over or is "won" when the Gamemaster's pre-determined goals have been achieved or the players have failed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Voting
publishers: Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University: Extension Division

name: Tippi Golf
description:
A "miniature" mini golf simulation.

On a fairway (length 66 cm) with variable obstacles (all made of plastic, 10 variants) a little marble should be places in the hole by a little figure (height 7 cm) with a golf club, activated by a button in it's neck. It's the same procedure like in the similar Tipp-Kick game.

name: Cthentacle: The Dunbitch Horror
description:
From the PDF:

Strange things are afoot in the town of Dunbitch on the edge of the Hockamock Swamp. The locals seem a little... strange and more than a little inbred from 'keeping their bloodline pure' and stranger things still have been seen and NOT seen...

Can Sheriff Cooter and BJ get to the bottom of the mystery or will they end up namesakes for the town?

The Dunbitch Horror expands Cthentacle with two new girls and a lot of new cards to take your Lovecraftian naughtiness to the next level.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult

name: Byg
description:
A 2 player abstract game, played with white and black stones on a Hexhex board. The goal is to have the largest group on the board when the game ends and the board is full. There is a trick, though: You can place as many stones per turn as you have groups on the board (up to a limit). There's a tricky balance: you need to connect your groups together to advance toward the goal, but you can't connect them too much or else you won't be able to place as many stones as your opponent.

The current rules:

1. The board begins empty.

2. To begin, White puts a single stone on any vacant space, and then Black does the same.

3. From then on, starting with Black, the players take turns. On your turn you may place as many stones as you have groups on the board, and you may place them onto any vacant spaces. Except:

*You must place at least one stone.
*The stones you place may not be adjacent to one another.
*If you have more than 3 groups on the board, the maximum number of stones you may place is 3.
*You may not grow any group by more than one stone.
*A stone connecting two or three different groups together is considered to have grown them all (at the end of your turn, no group may have more than one new stone in it).

4. The game ends when the board is full and the player with the largest group wins. If the players’ largest groups are the same size, compare their second-largest groups, and so on, until you come to a pair which aren't the same size. Whoever owns the larger group wins.

name: Zed Run!: The Survival Horror Game Show
description:
Survival horror game show set 25 years after the zed virus turned 90% of the worlds populaion into flesh eating zombies.

Players must explore a 7 x 7 grid of tiles laid out to create the play area, the Dead City. During this exploration, gathering items, weapons, and prizes is key, as your contestant is initially tossed unarmed into the fray. In combat, rolling a 6 on a D6 will score you a kill, and found weapons and items will better that chance. Hazard tiles will make the run a bit more "hazardous" -- such as adding scores of hungry dead, which you can plop down on your favorite rivals, or "Infection" which will change your recently deceased contestant, into a ZED, now bent on devouring your former rivals and able to control the actions for your lesser zombie brothers.

In Zed Run! you grab the loot, find the exit and win big... the rest is zombie chow!

Components
1 Start tile
48 ZR tiles
32 Zombie Tokens
15 Item Cards
10 Prize Cards
2 dice (six-sided)
4 Character / Zed Cards
4 Character Tokens

name: Monopoly: Schwarzwald
description:
From manufacturers description:

Monopoly Schwarzwald (black forest) by Winning Moves.
The regional editions of Monopoly. Who doesnt know the fascination of this game. With the regional editions one can play in different regions/cities/towns: the birthplace, the home region or a region where one always wanted to visit.

In my own words:
Monopoly Schwarzwald (black forest) is the adaptation of the famous Monopoly game unto the the black forest region in southern germany. A region with nice scenery and which is a famous tourist destination.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: ‰∏äÈô∏‰ΩúÊà¶
description:
This is operational level wargame for beginner. The battle modeled on Japanese Amphibious Operation in early stage of Pacific war.

One player control Japanese Invasion troops and other player control Allied Defense troops.
Rule based on standard wargame rules.
A victory is decide by capture of the capital in the game length limit.

name: Het Letterspel
description:
In this card-game you lay down your letter-cards to create words like in scrabble. Also, like scrabble you can add your cards to existing cards making words horizontal and vertical. Each card has a value and adding the values of your cards gives your score. As an addition the cards also have, besides the letters and their values, a part of a fish pictured on them. If your cards also forms a correct fish (head, body, maybe more body cards, tail) you score bonus points.

Content:
80 playing cards with letters and fish-parts.
3 rules cards.

name: Conqueror of Century's End
description:
This is man to man combat simulation game based on "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese Manga/Anime.
Each player control one character from story. Each character is shown with a metal miniature. They make the most of various Techniques corresponding to their battle styles.

A player decides Technique to use when the begining of each turn. The movement rate and battle ability of that turn depend on chosen Technique.
The movement is pre-plotted and then executed on the movement board simultaneously. The battle action is select battle chits secretly and then executed on the battle board simultaneously.
The purpose of most scenarios is to knock down a opponent character.

name: Professor Noggin's Presidents of the United States
description: Learn about the important people who helped shape and lead the United States. Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about the presidents of the United States.

name: Tembisa
description:
From the back of the box: Tembisa is a unique combination between card and dice game that allows you to play three different games which are all based on Africa and its adventures.

The three different games are:
1. Tembisa, the treasure hunt
2. Tembisa, the African farms
3. Tembisa Memory

The game materials consist of 1 die, 4 wooden pawns and 56 playing cards. Besides a startcard and finishcard (showing the treasure in a cave), the cards show different situations you come across (e.g. a hungry lion, a wild river, a giant snake, friendly villagepeople). Each card also shows a negative number, STOP, or 1 or 2 dice to roll.

1. Tembisa, the treasure hunt
A line is laid out of the playing cards. All cards, except for the start and endcard are placed facedown. A player rolls the die and moves his or her pawn accordingly. If the card where the pawn ends is not face upwards yet, do it now. In either case: this card shows a picture of what you met, together with a it's effect on your pawn: move it accordingly. (The number of places shown backwards, STOP or roll 1 or 2 extra dice.) The card where pawn ends up has no further effect for that players turn.
When six uncovered cards are in a uninterrupted row, this region is deemed fully explored. Only the positive cards keep their effect.
The player to reach the endcard showing the treasure first, wins the game.

2. Tembisa, the African farms
For this variant, the start and end card are not used.
